Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

There's no evidence that the special counsel investigation is a witch hunt or a hoax. In fact, the special counsel has revealed significant criminal activity by some of Trump's campaign advisers and by Russian individuals and entities. The investigation into potential collusion between Russia and Trump's campaign and obstruction of justice continues, and no conclusions have been announced.

Aug 30 2018

“Wow, Nellie Ohr, Bruce Ohr’s wife, is a Russia expert who is fluent in Russian. She worked for Fusion GPS where she was paid a lot. Collusion! Bruce was a boss at the Department of Justice and is, unbelievably, still there!”

Repeated 11 times
Oct 16, 2018Sep 18Aug 30Aug 30Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 17Aug 17Aug 14Aug 11

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump attacks a career Justice Department official, who had contacts with British agent Christopher Steele and Glenn Simpson of Fusion GPS, which was hired by the Democrats to investigate Trump's ties in Russia. He suggests that this makes the process "rigged" when in fact Ohr was not involved in the Russian investigation and it's unclear what role he might have played. Ohr's wife did assist in assembling the dossier, not all of which has been discredited.

Aug 29 2018

“Hillary Clinton’s Emails, many of which are Classified Information, got hacked by China.”

Topic: Election

Source: Twitter

In a rare move, the FBI publicly denied the president's claim. Trump was referring to a report in the conservative Daily Caller, which cited two anonymous sources. (That's ironic, since Trump frequently claims anonymous sources can't be trusted.)

Aug 29 2018

“Not only did Congressman Ron DeSantis easily win the Republican Primary, but his opponent in November is his biggest dream....a failed Socialist Mayor named Andrew Gillum who has allowed crime & many other problems to flourish in his city. This is not what Florida wants or needs!”

Topic: Crime

Source: Twitter

Crime has decreased overall since Gillum has been mayor of Tallahassee, although murders increased in 2017 and the area has the highest crime rates in Florida. Gillum is not a socialist. He had the backing of Sen. Bernie Sanders in the gubernatorial primary.

Aug 29 2018

“‘The Obama people did something that’s never been done...They spied on a rival presidential campaign. Would it be OK if Trump did it next? I am losing faith that our system is on the level. I’m beginning to think it is rotten & corrupt. Scary stuff Obama did.’ @TuckerCarlson DOJ”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

The FBI began to investigate some Trump campaign advisers based on national security concerns, namely that Russia was attempting to interfere in the 2016 election. Investigative warrants were duly authorized by judges. Trump suggests these criminal investigations were out of bounds, but there's no evidence that the investigations were tainted by corruption and in fact several Trump campaign advisers have pleaded guilty. Trump has previously claimed that Obama wiretapped his phones at Trump Tower, but there's no evidence of that, either.

Aug 29 2018

“‘Hillary Clinton and the DNC paid for information from the Russian government to use against her government - there’s no doubt about that!’ @TuckerCarlson”

Repeated 33 times
Oct 16, 2018Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 8Sep 11Sep 1Sep 1Aug 30Aug 29Aug 24Aug 17Aug 14Aug 9Jul 23Jul 23Jul 22May 21Apr 28Apr 27Apr 26Mar 25Feb 2Jan 10Jan 6Dec 28, 2017Dec 26Dec 8Nov 5Nov 2Oct 25Oct 19Jan 21

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

As for alleged collusion between the Democrats and Russia, Trump is referring to the fact that Fusion GPS, which {assembled a dossier as part of an assignment for Democrats}, relied on a British intelligence agent who used Russian sources for his research. So that's a rather big stretch.

Fact Checker rating:

Aug 29 2018

“When you see ‘anonymous source,’ stop reading the story, it is fiction!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump White House staff frequently speak to reporters on the condition of anonymity. Trump has a long history of being an anonymous source for reporters. He tweeted about an article based on anonymous sources on the same day. The article in the Daily Caller said China had hacked into Hillary Clinton's emails, but the FBI took the rare step of {denying} this claim after Trump's tweet.

Aug 29 2018

“For years, Google promoted President Obama's State of the Union on its homepage. When President Trump took office, Google stopped.”

Repeated 1 time
Aug 30, 2018

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Trump posted a video that purported to show how Google promoted the State of the Union address when Obama was president but not when Trump was president. But the video was fake; Google did promote Trump's 2018 State of the Union. "We have historically not promoted the first address to Congress by a new President, which is technically not a State of the Union address. As a result, we didn’t include a promotion on google.com for this address in either 2009 or 2017," Google said in a statement.

Aug 28 2018

“I smile at Senators and others talking about how good free trade is for the U.S. What they don’t say is that we lose Jobs and over 800 Billion Dollars a year on really dumb Trade Deals....and these same countries Tariff us to death. These lawmakers are just fine with this!”

Repeated 33 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 24Oct 17Oct 12Oct 1Sep 26Aug 31Aug 30Aug 28Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jun 25Jun 23Jun 14Jun 12Jun 9Jun 2May 17Mar 10Mar 9Mar 7Mar 6Mar 6Mar 5Mar 3Mar 2Nov 20, 2017Nov 15Nov 11Apr 2Mar 20Mar 15

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The U.S. trade deficit in 2017 was $566 billion, according to the Commerce Department. Trump gets his $800 billion number by looking only at the deficit for trade in goods ($810 billion) even though U.S. trade in services runs a substantial surplus of $244 billion. Trump regularly complains about the trade deficit with China, saying it is $500 billion. But it was $310 billion in 2016. The goods deficit in 2017 was $375 billion, but that will be lower when the trade in services figure is calculated.

Aug 28 2018

“Google search results for ‘Trump News’ shows only the viewing/reporting of Fake News Media. In other words, they have it RIGGED, for me & others, so that almost all stories & news is BAD. Fake CNN is prominent. Republican/Conservative & Fair Media is shut out. Illegal? 96% of.... ....results on 'Trump News' are from National Left-Wing Media, very dangerous.”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

There's no evidence that Google uses its influence to secretly suppress conservative media outlets when people search "Trump news." This 96 percent figure is based on a back-of-the-envelope analysis by a conservative writer (her article was later discussed on Fox News). She acknowledged her work was not scientific. Her analysis, in turn, is based on another conservative writer's ideological rankings of media organizations.

Aug 27 2018

“Thank you to the great @JimBrownNFL32, perhaps the greatest running back of all time, for your wonderful words and support. Since our meeting in New York, African-American UNEMPLOYMENT has reached the LOWEST LEVEL IN HISTORY. You get it!”

Repeated 91 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 23Oct 20Oct 17Oct 11Oct 8Oct 2Oct 2Sep 29Sep 20Sep 7Sep 7Sep 5Sep 5Sep 4Sep 2Aug 31Aug 31Aug 30Aug 27Aug 27Aug 16Aug 13Aug 13Aug 4Aug 1Aug 1Jul 27Jul 26Jul 24Jul 23Jul 19Jul 18Jul 16Jul 5Jul 3Jul 1Jun 29Jun 28Jun 27Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 20Jun 19Jun 18Jun 11Jun 7Jun 6Jun 6Jun 1May 28May 24May 24May 10May 4Apr 28Apr 27Apr 26Apr 18Apr 16Apr 12Mar 20Mar 13Mar 10Mar 6Feb 26Feb 24Feb 23Feb 12Feb 5Feb 1Jan 30Jan 28Jan 28Jan 26Jan 24Jan 19Jan 18Jan 16Jan 16Jan 16Jan 10Jan 8Jan 8Jan 6Sep 6, 2017Jul 25

Topic: Jobs

Source: Twitter

The black unemployment rate has been calculated only since 1972. Although the black unemployment rate was at an all-time-low 5.9 percent in May, it had risen to 6.6 percent in July. That was still significantly higher than the overall unemployment rate of 3.9 percent.

Aug 26 2018

““Mainstream Media tries to rewrite history to credit Obama for Trump accomplishments. Since President Trump took office, the economy is booming. The stronger the economy gets, the more desperate his critics are. O had weakest recovery since Great Depression.” @WashTimes”

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Trump is splitting hairs here. He inherited an economy that had largely already recovered from the recession and as The Post points out, his eighteen months resembles Obama's final years. Trump has brought new investment and sentiment has increased, but he can't claim all the credit for the country's economic well being.

Aug 26 2018

“Over 90% approval rating for your all time favorite (I hope) President within the Republican Party and 52% overall. This despite all of the made up stories by the Fake News Media trying endlessly to make me look as bad and evil as possible. Look at the real villains please!”

Repeated 8 times
Oct 27, 2018Aug 30Aug 30Aug 26Jul 31Jul 29Jul 13Jul 10

Topic: Biographical record

Source: Twitter

Not a single poll at the time showed Trump with a 52 percent approval rating; he was just below a 42 percent rating in the poll average maintained by FiveThirtyEight.com. A recent Gallup poll found that 90 percent of Republicans approve of Trump's performance. But that doesn't make him the "most popular Republican in history." George W. Bush maintained an approval rating close to 98 percent of Republicans during his first term.

Aug 25 2018

“Jeff Sessions said he wouldn’t allow politics to influence him only because he doesn’t understand what is happening underneath his command position. Highly conflicted Bob Mueller and his gang of 17 Angry Dems are having a field day as real corruption goes untouched. No Collusion!”

Repeated 29 times
Sep 18, 2018Sep 18Sep 16Sep 15Sep 7Sep 4Aug 25Aug 23Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 14Aug 5Aug 1Jul 21Jul 10Jun 28Jun 15Jun 15Jun 7Jun 7May 29May 27May 26May 7May 4Apr 26Mar 19Jun 23, 2017

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them.

Fact Checker rating:

Repeated 2 times
Aug 25, 2018Aug 25

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Trump is referring to a report from Real Clear Investigations that has not been independently confirmed by any other major news outlet. Former FBI Director James B. Comey testified that of the emails found on Weiner's laptop, "we've only had to personally read 6,000," because a computer scan could eliminate those that had already been reviewed.

Comey testified that of the emails found on Weiner's laptop, "we've only had to personally read 6,000," because a computer scan could eliminate those that had already been reviewed.

Aug 25 2018

“Big story out that the FBI ignored tens of thousands of Crooked Hillary Emails, many of which are REALLY BAD. Also gave false election info. I feel sure that we will soon be getting to the bottom of all of this corruption. At some point I may have to get involved!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Trump is referring to a report from Real Clear Investigations that has not been independently confirmed by any other major news outlet. Former FBI Director James B. Comey testified that of the emails found on Weiner's laptop, "we've only had to personally read 6,000," because a computer scan could eliminate those that had already been reviewed. The agents determined this did not change their original conclusion in the Clinton probe.

Fact Checker rating:

Aug 25 2018

“Social Media Giants are silencing millions of people. Can’t do this even if it means we must continue to hear Fake News like CNN, whose ratings have suffered gravely. People have to figure out what is real, and what is not, without censorship!”

Repeated 2 times
Aug 30, 2018Aug 21

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

It's not clear what Trump is talking about here. Social media networks have taken steps to regulate inaccurate news reports on their platforms to the dismay of some conservatives. But they claim they have not acted improperly. As for the White House's "standing up" to these policies, Trump's economic advisor is "taking a look at" whether Google search results should be regulated after a pre-dawn presidential tweet, but no official policy or action has been announced.

Aug 24 2018

“Ex-NSA contractor to spend 63 months in jail over “classified” information. Gee, this is “small potatoes” compared to what Hillary Clinton did! So unfair Jeff, Double Standard.”

Repeated 12 times
Oct 19, 2018Oct 18Oct 16Sep 7Aug 24Aug 23May 4Apr 9Dec 2, 2017Jul 25Jul 22Jul 19

Topic: Election

Source: Twitter

Clinton’s staff had requested the emails to be deleted months before the subpoena, according to the FBI’s August 2016 report. Moreover, there’s no evidence Clinton deleted the emails in anticipation of the subpoena, and FBI director James B. Comey has said his agency’s investigation found no evidence that any work-related emails were “intentionally deleted in an effort to conceal them.” The Hillary Clinton emails were deleted with a free software program known as BleachBit; there is no such thing as "acid washed."

Aug 24 2018

“Our Economy is setting records on virtually every front - Probably the best our country has ever done. Tremendous value created since the Election. The World is respecting us again! Companies are moving back to the U.S.A.”

Repeated 80 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 13Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 9Oct 9Oct 6Oct 6Oct 2Oct 2Oct 1Oct 1Sep 29Sep 26Sep 25Sep 24Sep 22Sep 21Sep 21Sep 21Sep 20Sep 20Sep 19Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 10Sep 8Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 6Sep 6Sep 5Aug 30Aug 30Aug 24Aug 24Aug 23Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 18Aug 17Aug 16Aug 16Aug 14Aug 12Aug 6Aug 4Jul 31Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jul 17Jul 16Jul 14Jul 14Jul 5Jul 3Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19Jun 17Jun 15Jun 14Jun 13Jun 9Jun 6Jun 5Jun 4

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the best ever goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come.

Fact Checker rating:

Aug 24 2018

““Department of Justice will not be improperly influenced by political considerations.” Jeff, this is GREAT, what everyone wants, so look into all of the corruption on the “other side” including deleted Emails, Comey lies & leaks, Mueller conflicts, McCabe, Strzok, Page, Ohr......FISA abuse, Christopher Steele & his phony and corrupt Dossier, the Clinton Foundation, illegal surveillance of Trump Campaign, Russian collusion by Dems - and so much more. Open up the papers & documents without redaction? Come on Jeff, you can do it, the country is waiting!”

Repeated 33 times
Oct 16, 2018Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 8Sep 11Sep 1Sep 1Aug 30Aug 29Aug 24Aug 17Aug 14Aug 9Jul 23Jul 23Jul 22May 21Apr 28Apr 27Apr 26Mar 25Feb 2Jan 10Jan 6Dec 28, 2017Dec 26Dec 8Nov 5Nov 2Oct 25Oct 19Jan 21

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

As for alleged collusion between the Democrats and Russia, Trump is referring to the fact that Fusion GPS, which assembled the dossier as part of an assignment for Democrats, relied on a British intelligence agent who used Russian sources for his research. So that's a rather big stretch. Plus, the FBI found Clinton's email usage to be "reckless" but not illegal. As we have reported, Comey did not leak classified information. Previously Trump has speculated that Comey lied to Senator Grassley about a disclosure made to the Wall Street Journal in 2016. But a new Inspector General report says Comey likely didn't know. If he's referring to the memos that Comey had passed on to a reporter after he was fired, that information was not classified. And despite months of claims, Mueller still has no documented conflicts of interest.

Source: Twitter

There's no evidence that the special counsel investigation is a witch hunt or a hoax. In fact, the special counsel has revealed significant criminal activity by some of Trump's campaign advisers and by Russian individuals and entities. Aug 22 2018

“I have asked Secretary of State @SecPompeo to closely study the South Africa land and farm seizures and expropriations and the large scale killing of farmers. ‘South African Government is now seizing land from white farmers.’ @TuckerCarlson @FoxNews”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump started off by tweeting a mostly false claim that South Africa was seizing land from white farmers. The South African government is considering plans to redistribute private farmland, which is owned mostly by whites, but this plan is not yet final and Trump’s protest appears to have been spurred by one test case. Then, seemingly out of nowhere, Trump added an outlandish and baseless claim that South African farmers are being killed on a “large scale.” He prodded the secretary of state to investigate this myth fueled by white supremacists. He earned Four Pinocchios for that.

Fact Checker rating:

Aug 22 2018

“Michael Cohen plead guilty to two counts of campaign finance violations that are not a crime. President Obama had a big campaign finance violation and it was easily settled!”

Topic: Election

Source: Twitter

The Cohen and Obama cases are quite different. A {Washington Post} report explained, "A case like Obama’s — which was a civil infraction — is much more common and less serious than a criminal cases such as Cohen’s, in which there was a knowing violation of election law that carries prison time." In other words, Trump's assessment should be reversed.

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

There's no reason to suggest that Michael Cohen's plea deal is based on false testimony. Generally, if a witness lies to prosecutors after making a deal, prosecutors can dissolve that deal. in other words, it would be against Cohen's interests to say anything false.

The president’s first claim about land seizures has some merit but is mostly false. Trump’s second claim, that South African farmers are being killed on a “large scale,” is a fiction not supported by data. We have no clue how this myth about farmers being killed ended up on the president’s Twitter feed. But it has been swishing in the alt-right and white-nationalist ether for years.

Full story

As {the Fact Checker} previously noted, some sloppy dot connecting leads to the assumption that Clapper briefed Tapper about the dossier in January 2017. No one has pinned down the exact date, but in the fuller transcript of Clapper's testimony, he says he only discussed it after it was in the media.

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Plus, there's no evidence that Mueller and Comey are best friends.

Repeated 27 times
Oct 10, 2018Oct 3Sep 6Sep 5Sep 5Aug 30Aug 19Jul 23Jul 13Jul 7Jul 5May 9Jan 2Nov 30, 2017Oct 5Sep 27Aug 22Aug 7Jul 2Jul 1Jun 27Mar 29Feb 27Feb 16Feb 6Feb 4Jan 28

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Rather than failing, The Times has seen spikes in audience and subscribers. Plus, it is unusual for an attorney to provide that much testimony about a client. While McGahn did testify voluntarily, Trump could not evoke executive privilege to stop him. The Supreme Court {ruled} privilege can only be used in a criminal investigation if it relates to military or diplomatic matters.

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

While Trump harkens back to the days when the United States was a developing country and used tariffs to protect nascent industries, tariffs in the modern era have led to economic catastrophe, such as the Smoot–Hawley Tariff which exacerbated the Great Depression.

He hired her at several points since 2004 when she first appeared on "The Apprentice."

Repeated 29 times
Sep 18, 2018Sep 18Sep 16Sep 15Sep 7Sep 4Aug 25Aug 23Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 14Aug 5Aug 1Jul 21Jul 10Jun 28Jun 15Jun 15Jun 7Jun 7May 29May 27May 26May 7May 4Apr 26Mar 19Jun 23, 2017

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them.

Fact Checker rating:

Aug 13 2018

“Just fired Agent Strzok, formerly of the FBI, was in charge of the Crooked Hillary Clinton sham investigation. It was a total fraud on the American public and should be properly redone!”

Topic: Election

Source: Twitter

Former FBI agent Peter Strzok sent anti-Trump text messages in 2016 and was criticized by the Justice Department's inspector general. But the IG report also found that no improper biases or considerations went into the FBI's decision making in 2016. Strzok led a team of investigators looking into Clinton's use of a private email server. The FBI found it did not merit criminal charges.

Aug 12 2018

“'Seems like the Department of Justice (and FBI) had a program to keep Donald Trump from becoming President'”. @DarrellIssa @foxandfriends If this had happened to the other side, everybody involved would be in jail. This is a Media coverup of the biggest story of our time.”

Aug 11 2018

“Why isn’t the FBI giving Andrew McCabe text messages to Judicial Watch or appropriate governmental authorities. FBI said they won’t give up even one (I may have to get involved, DO NOT DESTROY). What are they hiding? McCabe wife took big campaign dollars from Hillary people.”

Repeated 14 times
Oct 11, 2018Aug 11May 18Apr 28Apr 26Apr 15Mar 17Jan 24Dec 24, 2017Dec 23Dec 3Jul 26Jul 25Jul 19

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Full story

Andrew McCabe, who is now the acting FBI director, became part of the investigation of Hillary Clinton’s emails long after his wife, Jill McCabe, unsuccessfully ran for a Virginia Senate seat. The political action committee of Virginia Gov. Terry McAuliffe (D) gave $452,500 to McCabe, and the state Democratic Party gave her campaign an additional $207,788. That was about one-third of the $1.8 million budget for her campaign. McAuliffe is close to Clinton, but there is no evidence she knew of the contributions. Moreover, it stretches the imagination that McAuliffe would know that the husband of someone he was supporting in a Virginia legislative race was going to be promoted months later to a position of authority in the email case.

Fact Checker rating:

Topic: Jobs

Source: Twitter

Trump gives himself too much credit here. Unemployment rates were already dropping when he was elected president and he did not do anything special for minority groups to reduce unemployment.

Aug 10 2018

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Most of the money does not go to the players. Under the terms of the NFL’s current collective bargaining agreement, which runs through the 2020 season, players are entitled to no more than 48.5 percent of the NFL’s revenue, including income from media rights deals, corporate partnerships and other sources.

Aug 8 2018

“The Republicans have now won 8 out of 9 House Seats, yet if you listen to the Fake News Media you would think we are being clobbered. Why can’t they play it straight, so unfair to the Republican Party and in particular, your favorite President!”

Topic:

Source: Twitter

Republicans have narrowly won races in strongly Republicans districts that they should have easily won, which is why analysts say Republicans are in danger of losing control of the House of Representatives. The Cook Political report estimated that the Democrats outperformed by an average of eight percentage points -- which would signal the Democratic takeover. Moreover, Republicans have won 8 out of 10 special elections.

Aug 8 2018

“As long as I campaign and/or support Senate and House candidates (within reason), they will win! I LOVE the people, & they certainly seem to like the job I’m doing. If I find the time, in between China, Iran, the Economy and much more, which I must, we will have a giant Red Wave!”

Topic:

Source: Twitter

Trump's candidates in Republican primaries have almost always won, but four of his endorsed candidates have lost their elections.

Aug 7 2018

“When I decided to go to Ohio for Troy Balderson, he was down in early voting 64 to 36. That was not good. After my speech on Saturday night, there was a big turn for the better. Now Troy wins a great victory during a very tough time of the year for voting. He will win BIG in Nov......Congratulations to Troy Balderson on a great win in Ohio. A very special and important race!

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Trump congratulated Balderson while the race was still too close to call. No major network had named him the winner.

Aug 6 2018

“California wildfires are being magnified & made so much worse by the bad environmental laws which aren’t allowing massive amounts of readily available water to be properly utilized. It is being diverted into the Pacific Ocean. Must also tree clear to stop fire from spreading!”

Topic: Environment

Source: Twitter

Experts said that Trump's tweet made no sense. California does divert water from its rivers, as Trump suggests — but not into the Pacific. As the state's population has grown, its residents have redirected water to cities for drinking and to farmlands for irrigating. The water that remains in California's rivers still does what it had always done — flow from their headwaters at higher elevations down into the ocean. The California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection said it has more than enough water to fight the blazes.

Aug 6 2018

“Governor Jerry Brown must allow the Free Flow of the vast amounts of water coming from the North and foolishly being diverted into the Pacific Ocean. Can be used for fires, farming and everything else. Think of California with plenty of Water - Nice! Fast Federal govt. approvals.”

Topic: Environment

Source: Twitter

Experts said that Trump's tweet made no sense. California does divert water from its rivers, as Trump suggests — but not into the Pacific. As the state's population has grown, its residents have redirected water to cities for drinking and to farmlands for irrigating. The water that remains in California's rivers still does what it had always done — flow from their headwaters at higher elevations down into the ocean. The California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection said it has more than enough water to fight the blazes.

Aug 6 2018

“Great financial numbers being announced on an almost daily basis. Economy has never been better, jobs at best point in history. Fixing our terrible Trade Deals is a priority-and going very well. Immigration on Merit Based System to take care of the companies coming back to U.S.A.”

Repeated 80 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 13Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 9Oct 9Oct 6Oct 6Oct 2Oct 2Oct 1Oct 1Sep 29Sep 26Sep 25Sep 24Sep 22Sep 21Sep 21Sep 21Sep 20Sep 20Sep 19Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 10Sep 8Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 6Sep 6Sep 5Aug 30Aug 30Aug 24Aug 24Aug 23Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 18Aug 17Aug 16Aug 16Aug 14Aug 12Aug 6Aug 4Jul 31Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jul 17Jul 16Jul 14Jul 14Jul 5Jul 3Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19Jun 17Jun 15Jun 14Jun 13Jun 9Jun 6Jun 5Jun 4

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the “greatest ever” goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come.

Fact Checker rating:

Full story

Trump continues to falsely say the Democrats colluded with Russian even though it was the victim of the hacking attack used by Russia to influence the election outcome, according to the intelligence community.

Fact Checker rating:

Aug 5 2018

“The Fake News hates me saying that they are the Enemy of the People only because they know it’s TRUE. I am providing a great service by explaining this to the American People. They purposely cause great division & distrust. They can also cause War! They are very dangerous & sick!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

President Trump has a habit of calling stories he finds unflattering "fake news," but that doesn't mean that they are not true. Plus, while a story by the press may have the ability to shift public opinion, it certainly cannot "cause a war." That can only be done by Congress and the president.

Aug 5 2018

“Tariffs are working big time. Every country on earth wants to take wealth out of the U.S., always to our detriment. I say, as they come,Tax them. If they don’t want to be taxed, let them make or build the product in the U.S. In either event, it means jobs and great wealth.”

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

There are winners and losers with tariffs, and some companies have begun to lay off workers while farmers face the prospect of big losses on crops. Trump has imposed tariffs on certain goods imported from foreign countries, but the foreign countries do not pay those tariffs. Rather, the U.S. importers bringing the products into the United States pay the tariffs. This makes the products more expensive and less attractive for U.S. consumers. This could drive U.S. importers to stop bringing in certain goods because they are too costly, hurting the foreign manufacturers, but those foreign companies do not pay the tariffs, and neither do the foreign countries where those companies are based.

Aug 5 2018

“Because of Tariffs we will be able to start paying down large amounts of the $21 Trillion in debt that has been accumulated, much by the Obama Administration, while at the same time reducing taxes for our people. At minimum, we will make much better Trade Deals for our country!”

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

This is an absurd statement. Trump's tax policies have added significantly to the rising budget deficit, meaning the debt is rising and he has no way to pay it down. The tariffs so far imposed raise relatively little money, meaning it makes barely a dent in the deficit, let alone the debt.

Aug 5 2018

“Fake News reporting, a complete fabrication, that I am concerned about the meeting my wonderful son, Donald, had in Trump Tower. This was a meeting to get information on an opponent, totally legal and done all the time in politics - and it went nowhere. I did not know about it!”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Veterans of previous presidential campaigns from both parties said it would be very odd and highly unusual to accept opposition research from foreign officials. Many said they would not have taken the meeting and would have reported the contact immediately to the FBI.

“...Why aren’t Mueller and the 17 Angry Democrats looking at the meetings concerning the Fake Dossier and all of the lying that went on in the FBI and DOJ? This is the most one sided Witch Hunt in the history of our country. Fortunately, the facts are all coming out, and fast!”

Sep 18, 2018Sep 18Sep 16Sep 15Sep 7Sep 4Aug 25Aug 23Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 14Aug 5Aug 1Jul 21Jul 10Jun 28Jun 15Jun 15Jun 7Jun 7May 29May 27May 26May 7May 4Apr 26Mar 19Jun 23, 2017

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them.

Aug 4 2018

“....Tariffs have had a tremendous positive impact on our Steel Industry. Plants are opening all over the U.S., Steelworkers are working again, and big dollars are flowing into our Treasury. Other countries use Tariffs against, but when we use them, foolish people scream!”

Repeated 26 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 27Oct 17Oct 12Oct 10Oct 10Oct 1Sep 29Sep 17Sep 7Aug 31Aug 31Aug 30Aug 30Aug 24Aug 21Aug 13Aug 4Aug 4Jul 23Jun 26Jun 26Mar 14Mar 6Mar 6Mar 2

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

This is mostly false. Steel plants are not opening "all over the U.S." after Trump imposed steel tariffs. In fact, trade and economic experts say the tariffs could cost U.S. jobs. Although some investments have been announced, the steel industry was not going out of business, as Trump suggests. Big integrated steel mills had trouble competing with more nimble and efficient mini-mills.

Repeated 5 times
Aug 2, 2018Jul 31Jul 30Jul 29Jul 27

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Full story

The $52 billion figure is based on a misinterpretation of the Commerce Department data; in reality the drop in the trade deficit between the first and secon quarters is about $20 billion. For the first half of the year, the trade deficit increased and is on track to be the biggest since 2008. Many experts think that the data was affected by the fact that companies overseas rushed to buy U.S. goods before Trump’s tariffs took effect.

Trump ignores the fact that Mueller is a Republican and was appointed by his administration. Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Trump suggests that Mueller, a Republican, worked for Obama for 8 years but that's not true; moreover, he was appointed FBI director by George W. Bush. The "nasty" business relationship apparently refers to a private dispute with Mueller over dues at Trump's golf club in Sterling, Va.

Jul 27 2018

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

A 4.1 percent quarterly increase in the gross domestic product is good, but it is not amazing. Obama and other presidents exceeded that level on numerous occasions. What matters is the annual rate -- and Trump promised four-percent annual growth.

Topic: Economy

Trump exaggerates the impact of his policies on the economy, which had been growing at a steady pace before he was elected. The United States has added jobs for 94 straight months, of which 18 were under Trump's leadership.

Jul 24 2018

Topic:

Source: Twitter

Tariffs cause winners and losers, and already some companies in the United States have had to lay off workers. Trump misunderstands the impact of trade deficits; the United States was not a "piggy bank" being robbed but benefited from rising trade with other countries.

Full story

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the “best financial numbers” goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come.

Fact Checker rating:

Jul 24 2018

“I’m very concerned that Russia will be fighting very hard to have an impact on the upcoming Election. Based on the fact that no President has been tougher on Russia than me, they will be pushing very hard for the Democrats. They definitely don’t want Trump!”

Repeated 13 times
Aug 2, 2018Jul 24Apr 28Apr 27Apr 26Apr 18Apr 3Apr 3Mar 5Feb 24Feb 21Feb 20Feb 19

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

There is no evidence that Russia favors Democrats, either in the 2016 election or in the upcoming elections. U.S. intelligence concluded that Russia worked to help get Trump elected. Moreover, Trump has not been tougher on Russia. Sanctions have been imposed by Congress, despite Trump's efforts to weaken them.

Jul 24 2018

“Every time I see a weak politician asking to stop Trade talks or the use of Tariffs to counter unfair Tariffs, I wonder, what can they be thinking? Are we just going to continue and let our farmers and country get ripped off? Lost $817 Billion on Trade last year. No weakness!”

Repeated 33 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 24Oct 17Oct 12Oct 1Sep 26Aug 31Aug 30Aug 28Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jun 25Jun 23Jun 14Jun 12Jun 9Jun 2May 17Mar 10Mar 9Mar 7Mar 6Mar 6Mar 5Mar 3Mar 2Nov 20, 2017Nov 15Nov 11Apr 2Mar 20Mar 15

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The U.S. trade deficit in 2017 was $566 billion, according to the Commerce Department. Trump gets his $817 billion number by looking only at the deficit for trade in goods ($810 billion) even though U.S. trade in services runs a substantial surplus of $244 billion. Trump regularly complains about the trade deficit with China, saying it is $500 billion. But it was $310 billion in 2016. The goods deficit in 2017 was $375 billion, but that will be lower when the trade in services figure is calculated. Moreover, the United States does not "lose" money on trade deficits.

Jul 24 2018

“China made $517 Billion on us last year.”

Repeated 88 times
Oct 29, 2018Oct 27Oct 27Oct 27Oct 26Oct 24Oct 17Oct 17Oct 14Oct 13Oct 13Oct 12Oct 12Oct 11Oct 9Oct 9Oct 9Oct 6Oct 4Oct 2Oct 2Oct 2Oct 1Oct 1Sep 29Sep 26Sep 26Sep 21Sep 20Sep 17Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Aug 30Aug 29Aug 23Aug 16Aug 7Aug 4Jul 31Jul 26Jul 24Jul 19Jul 13Jun 28Jun 27Jun 26Jun 23Jun 20Jun 19Jun 15Jun 12May 24May 22May 18May 15Apr 28Apr 18Apr 16Apr 12Apr 7Apr 6Apr 5Apr 4Apr 3Mar 23Mar 22Mar 22Mar 14Mar 10Mar 9Mar 9Mar 8Mar 6Mar 5Mar 1Feb 26Feb 23Feb 13Feb 13Dec 28, 2017Nov 11Nov 9Nov 6Jul 25Apr 4Feb 23

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The trade deficit in goods and services in 2017 with China was $375 billion. Trump often just cites the goods deficit, which was $505 billion, according to the Census Bureau. And the trade deficit does not mean that China "made money" to that amount on the United States.

Jul 23 2018

“It was classified to cover up misconduct by the FBI and the Justice Department in misleading the Court by using this Dossier in a dishonest way to gain a warrant to target the Trump Team. Repeated 33 times
Oct 16, 2018Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 8Sep 11Sep 1Sep 1Aug 30Aug 29Aug 24Aug 17Aug 14Aug 9Jul 23Jul 23Jul 22May 21Apr 28Apr 27Apr 26Mar 25Feb 2Jan 10Jan 6Dec 28, 2017Dec 26Dec 8Nov 5Nov 2Oct 25Oct 19Jan 21

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

While the dossier commissioned by Fusion GPS for Democrats contained salacious elements, broad portions have proven to be largely correct. Fusion has said the former British spy who wrote it received $168,000. The FBI was sufficiently impressed that it considered pay him for additional research. The timing of the FISA warrant confirms that Carter Page was no longer working for the Trump campaign in any capacity when his communications started being monitored. In other words, it was not a front to surveil the campaign. Plus, the FBI inspector general report found no evidence that any decisions that were made with relationship to the Clinton or Trump investigations in 2016 were politically motivated.

Fact Checker rating:

Jul 23 2018

“When you hear the Fake News talking negatively about my meeting with President Putin, and all that I gave up, remember, I gave up NOTHING, we merely talked about future benefits for both countries. Also, we got along very well, which is a good thing, except for the Corrupt Media!”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Since Trump met alone with Putin and no detailed readout has been given, it is uncertain whether Trump gave up anything. However, simply be meeting with Putin despite U.S. sanctions and no change in Russian behavior, Trump offered the Russian president significant diplomatic benefits.

Jul 23 2018

“A Rocket has not been launched by North Korea in 9 months. Likewise, no Nuclear Tests. Japan is happy, all of Asia is happy. But the Fake News is saying, without ever asking me (always anonymous sources), that I am angry because it is not going fast enough. Wrong, very happy!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

North Korea has a long history of making agreements and then not living up to its obligations. The document signed by Trump and Kim was not “very comprehensive” but remarkably vague, leaving it open to interpretation and debate, compared to previous documents signed by North Korea. The statement said North Korea (officially the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea, or DPRK) committed to “work towards the complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.” The phrase is not defined and “toward” is rather weak. In the past, North Korea viewed “denuclearization” to mean the United States removing the nuclear umbrella it provides to Japan and South Korea; there is no indication its definition has changed.

Jul 23 2018

“The Amazon Washington Post has gone crazy against me ever since they lost the Internet Tax Case in the U.S. Supreme Court two months ago. Next up is the U.S. Post Office which they use, at a fraction of real cost, as their “delivery boy” for a BIG percentage of their packages … In my opinion the Washington Post is nothing more than an expensive (the paper loses a fortune) lobbyist for Amazon. Is it used as protection against antitrust claims which many feel should be brought?”

Repeated 27 times
Oct 10, 2018Oct 3Sep 6Sep 5Sep 5Aug 30Aug 19Jul 23Jul 13Jul 7Jul 5May 9Jan 2Nov 30, 2017Oct 5Sep 27Aug 22Aug 7Jul 2Jul 1Jun 27Mar 29Feb 27Feb 16Feb 6Feb 4Jan 28

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Amazon chief executive Jeffrey P. Bezos has owned The Washington Post since 2013 as a personal investment. The two companies operate independently of each other. The Post has been profitable for the last two years. Amazon charged sales taxes in every state with a sales tax before the U.S. Supreme Court’s ruling in South Dakota v. Wayfair in June. The company also offered to charge sales taxes for third-party vendors selling products through Amazon.com before the court’s decision. The U.S. Postal Service gives Amazon bulk-shipping rates and says its relationship with Amazon is profitable.

Jul 21 2018

“Inconceivable that the government would break into a lawyer’s office (early in the morning) - almost unheard of. Even more inconceivable that a lawyer would tape a client - totally unheard of & perhaps illegal. The good news is that your favorite President did nothing wrong!”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

There are slew of falsehoods in this tweet. First of all, FBI agents did not "break into" Michael Cohen's office. They were executing a search order that had been approved by a federal judge. In New York state, only one party needs consent to a recording. That means it is not illegal for a lawyer to record a client. As for Cohen taping Trump, The Post reported in April, it was a regular practice of Cohen's that Trump knew about. Lastly, Trump is not America's "favorite President." At the time of this tweet, his approval rating had dipped to 42 percent.

Jul 21 2018

“The Rigged Witch Hunt, headed by the 13 Angry Democrats (and now 4 more have been added, one who worked directly for Obama W.H.), seems intent on damaging the Republican Party’s chances in the November Election. This Democrat excuse for losing the ‘16 Election never ends!”

Repeated 29 times
Sep 18, 2018Sep 18Sep 16Sep 15Sep 7Sep 4Aug 25Aug 23Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 14Aug 5Aug 1Jul 21Jul 10Jun 28Jun 15Jun 15Jun 7Jun 7May 29May 27May 26May 7May 4Apr 26Mar 19Jun 23, 2017

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Trump suggests that Mueller, a Republican, worked for Obama for 8 years but that's not true; moreover, he was appointed FBI director by George W. Bush.

Jul 20 2018

“The NFL National Anthem Debate is alive and well again - can’t believe it! Isn’t it in contract that players must stand at attention, hand on heart? The $40,000,000 Commissioner must now make a stand. First time kneeling, out for game. Second time kneeling, out for season/no pay!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

The NFL policy actually says players must stand if they’re on the field while the anthem plays or stay in their locker rooms for the anthem. Some teams have announced they will not fine players or coaches for kneeling on the sidelines during the anthem despite the NFL’s new policy. Roger Goodell, the NFL commissioner, signed a contract extension in late 2017 worth $200 million over five years if — and this is a big if — all incentives are met and bonuses are granted. Goodell’s base salary reportedly is less than $10 million annually. Plus, over several previous seasons, the commissioner’s salary was cut repeatedly.

Jul 18 2018

Repeated 87 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 22Oct 17Oct 16Oct 14Oct 12Oct 12Oct 9Oct 9Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 4Sep 4Aug 30Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 21Aug 14Aug 14Aug 2Jul 30Jul 26Jul 18Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 14Jul 14Jul 13Jul 13Jul 13Jul 12Jul 12Jul 12Jul 11Jul 11Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 5Jul 5Jul 5Jul 5Jun 29Jun 25Jun 23Jun 14Jun 12Apr 27Apr 18Apr 3Apr 3Apr 3Mar 8Dec 18, 2017Dec 8Nov 15Jul 6Jul 6Jun 9Jun 2May 30May 27May 25May 25May 25May 25May 8Apr 29Apr 29Apr 21Mar 22Mar 18Mar 17Feb 28

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Full story

NATO’s guideline, established in 2006, is that defense expenditures should amount to 2 percent of each country’s gross domestic product. Defense spending has increased 11.7 billion over the past year. But the money would not be going to the United States or even necessarily to NATO; this is money that countries would spend to bolster their own military, not any "reimbursement."

Repeated 80 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 13Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 9Oct 9Oct 6Oct 6Oct 2Oct 2Oct 1Oct 1Sep 29Sep 26Sep 25Sep 24Sep 22Sep 21Sep 21Sep 21Sep 20Sep 20Sep 19Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 10Sep 8Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 6Sep 6Sep 5Aug 30Aug 30Aug 24Aug 24Aug 23Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 18Aug 17Aug 16Aug 16Aug 14Aug 12Aug 6Aug 4Jul 31Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jul 17Jul 16Jul 14Jul 14Jul 5Jul 3Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19Jun 17Jun 15Jun 14Jun 13Jun 9Jun 6Jun 5Jun 4

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the “greatest ever” goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come.

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Full story

NATO’s guideline, established in 2006, is that defense expenditures should amount to 2 percent of each country’s gross domestic product. In 2016, only four countries besides the United States met that standard, but NATO documents also show that defense spending has increased about three percent from 2015 to 2016. In any case, the money would not be going to the United States or even necessarily to NATO; this is money that countries would spend to bolster their own military.

Jul 14 2018

“Where is the DNC Server, and why didn’t the FBI take possession of it? Deep State?”

Repeated 16 times
Aug 30, 2018Jul 17Jul 16Jul 14Jul 1May 20Apr 26Apr 18Nov 11, 2017Aug 10Jul 9Jul 7May 7Apr 30Mar 20Mar 5

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

The FBI and the Democratic National Committee disagree on whether the FBI requested access to the DNC's servers. FBI Director James Comey testified to the Senate Intelligence Committee that the bureau made "multiple requests at different levels" to access DNC's servers, but the DNC said the FBI never requested access. The DNC ultimately allowed a private company to review its database and share findings with the FBI, which then FBI Director said was sufficient.

Jul 14 2018

“The Stock Market hit 25,000 yesterday. Jobs are at an all time record - and that is before we fix some of the worst trade deals and conditions ever seen by any government. It is all happening!”

Repeated 80 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 13Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 9Oct 9Oct 6Oct 6Oct 2Oct 2Oct 1Oct 1Sep 29Sep 26Sep 25Sep 24Sep 22Sep 21Sep 21Sep 21Sep 20Sep 20Sep 19Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 10Sep 8Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 6Sep 6Sep 5Aug 30Aug 30Aug 24Aug 24Aug 23Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 18Aug 17Aug 16Aug 16Aug 14Aug 12Aug 6Aug 4Jul 31Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jul 17Jul 16Jul 14Jul 14Jul 5Jul 3Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19Jun 17Jun 15Jun 14Jun 13Jun 9Jun 6Jun 5Jun 4

Topic: Jobs

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the “best financial numbers” goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come.

Repeated 87 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 22Oct 17Oct 16Oct 14Oct 12Oct 12Oct 9Oct 9Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 4Sep 4Aug 30Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 21Aug 14Aug 14Aug 2Jul 30Jul 26Jul 18Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 14Jul 14Jul 13Jul 13Jul 13Jul 12Jul 12Jul 12Jul 11Jul 11Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 5Jul 5Jul 5Jul 5Jun 29Jun 25Jun 23Jun 14Jun 12Apr 27Apr 18Apr 3Apr 3Apr 3Mar 8Dec 18, 2017Dec 8Nov 15Jul 6Jul 6Jun 9Jun 2May 30May 27May 25May 25May 25May 25May 8Apr 29Apr 29Apr 21Mar 22Mar 18Mar 17Feb 28

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Full story

NATO’s guideline, established in 2006, is that defense expenditures should amount to 2 percent of each country’s gross domestic product. In 2014, countries agreed to meet this level by 2024. Defense spending by NATO members has steadily increased since then. Members spent an additional $11.7 billion over the past year. But the money would not be going to the United States or even necessarily to NATO; this is money that countries would spend to bolster their own military.

Jul 11 2018

“I am in Brussels, but always thinking about our farmers. Soy beans fell 50% from 2012 to my election. Farmers have done poorly for 15 years. Other countries’ trade barriers and tariffs have been destroying their businesses.”

Repeated 16 times
Oct 2, 2018Oct 1Sep 26Sep 20Sep 17Sep 7Sep 7Aug 24Aug 23Aug 16Aug 1Jul 31Jul 11Jul 1Jun 27Jun 9

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

National net farm income, a key indicator of how well farmers are doing, has been declining since 2013 — meaning five, not 15, years. “U.S. farm income experienced a golden period during 2011 through 2014 due to strong commodity prices and robust agricultural exports,” according to the nonpartisan Congressional Research Service. However, the price of soybeans has not dropped “50 percent since 5 years before the election,” according to U.S. Department of Agriculture data. In 2011, five years before the 2016 election, soybeans peaked at $13.40 per bushel. In May 2018, soybeans cost $9.84 per bushel. That’s a 27 percent drop. Measuring since 2011, the lowest price was $8.56 in March 2016. Tariffs and trade barriers are not pushing these prices down; record soybean plantings and record yields are the cause.

Jul 11 2018

“What good is NATO if Germany is paying Russia billions of dollars for gas and energy? Why are there only 5 out of 29 countries that have met their commitment? The U.S. is paying for Europe’s protection, then loses billions on Trade. Must pay 2% of GDP IMMEDIATELY, not by 2025.”

Repeated 87 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 22Oct 17Oct 16Oct 14Oct 12Oct 12Oct 9Oct 9Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 4Sep 4Aug 30Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 21Aug 14Aug 14Aug 2Jul 30Jul 26Jul 18Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 14Jul 14Jul 13Jul 13Jul 13Jul 12Jul 12Jul 12Jul 11Jul 11Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 5Jul 5Jul 5Jul 5Jun 29Jun 25Jun 23Jun 14Jun 12Apr 27Apr 18Apr 3Apr 3Apr 3Mar 8Dec 18, 2017Dec 8Nov 15Jul 6Jul 6Jun 9Jun 2May 30May 27May 25May 25May 25May 25May 8Apr 29Apr 29Apr 21Mar 22Mar 18Mar 17Feb 28

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

This isn't how NATO funding works at all. The U.S. pays 22 percent of NATO's organizational expenses (its headquarters in Brussels and common programs). The rest of the spending across the alliance is simply what each country appropriates for its own defense. NATO's guideline is for members to spend 2 percent of their GDP on defense by 2024. When members fail to meet this threshold, that doesn't mean that the U.S. paid their defense expenses for them.

In any case, Strzok worked on special counsel Robert Mueller's team in June and July 2017, months after the ongoing investigation began.

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The actual trade deficit with the EU is about $100 billion because the U.S. has a services surplus of about $50 billion. Trump's focus on the trade deficit is misplaced, as the United States and the EU have total trade in goods of more than $700 billion, with U.S. exports to the EU in 2015 supporting more than 2.6 million U.S. jobs, according to the Census Bureau.

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

The Emerson professor who helped lead the study told the Boston Globe Trump cherry-picked the data and exaggerated results. He noted that about 50 percent of total respondents said they disapprove of Trump’s job as president. And when asked whether they would rather have Trump or Obama as president, half chose Obama.

Sep 18, 2018Sep 18Sep 16Sep 15Sep 7Sep 4Aug 25Aug 23Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 14Aug 5Aug 1Jul 21Jul 10Jun 28Jun 15Jun 15Jun 7Jun 7May 29May 27May 26May 7May 4Apr 26Mar 19Jun 23, 2017

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Trump suggests that Mueller, a Republican, worked for Obama for 8 years but that's not true; moreover, he was appointed FBI director by George W. Bush.

Jul 10 2018

“Getting ready to leave for Europe. First meeting - NATO. The U.S. is spending many times more than any other country in order to protect them. Not fair to the U.S. taxpayer. On top of that we lose $151 Billion on Trade with the European Union. Charge us big Tariffs (& Barriers)!”

Repeated 49 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 23Oct 17Oct 12Oct 11Oct 6Oct 2Oct 1Sep 20Sep 17Aug 21Jul 25Jul 24Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 13Jul 13Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 5Jul 1Jun 29Jun 28Jun 27Jun 27Jun 26Jun 25Jun 23Jun 15Jun 14Jun 12Jun 7Jun 1May 17Apr 28Apr 27Apr 16Apr 12Apr 12Apr 12Mar 14Mar 10Mar 6Mar 5Mar 3Jan 28

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The actual trade deficit with the EU is about $100 billion because the U.S. has a services surplus of about $50 billion. Trump's focus on the trade deficit is misplaced, as the United States and the EU have total trade in goods of more than $700 billion, with U.S. exports to the EU in 2015 supporting more than 2.6 million U.S. jobs, according to the Census Bureau.

Jul 9 2018

“The United States is spending far more on NATO than any other Country. This is not fair, nor is it acceptable. While these countries have been increasing their contributions since I took office, they must do much more. Germany is at 1%, the U.S. is at 4%, and NATO benefits....... ...Europe far more than it does the U.S. By some accounts, the U.S. is paying for 90% of NATO, with many countries nowhere close to their 2% commitment. On top of this the European Union has a Trade Surplus of $151 Million with the U.S., with big Trade Barriers on U.S. goods. NO!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Trump seems to have mixed up millions with billions in his oft-repeated and misleading claim that the EU has a $151 billion trade surplus with the United States (it's actually around $100 billion). The EU and the U.S. have the largest bilateral trade relationship in the world, and both sides impose tariffs and other barriers on different products. Trump never gets the NATO funding dynamics right. There are two types of funding for NATO: direct funding and indirect funding. Direct funding, for military-related operations, maintenance and headquarters activity, is based on gross national income — the total domestic and foreign output claimed by residents of a country — and adjusted regularly. With the largest economy in NATO, the United States pays the largest share — about 22 percent. Germany is second, with about 15 percent. A significant portion of the U.S. share is operating the Airborne Early Warning and Control System (AWACS) fleet, according to the Congressional Research Service. The U.S. share of the actual military budget is negotiated each year, but largely based on the cost-sharing formula, and amounts to less than $500 million a year, according to Defense Department documents. That’s chump change in a $700 billion military budget. As for indirect funding, since 2006, each NATO member has had a guideline of spending at least 2 percent of gross domestic product on defense spending. At a 2014 summit, responding to Russian aggression in Ukraine, NATO members pledged to meet that guideline by 2024. As of 2017, 12 of the 28 members exceed the guideline — with the United States leading the way at 3.6 percent. But this is simply money that each country would spend on its own military — or on missions that do not include NATO, such as peacekeeping in Africa.

Fact Checker rating:

“The stupidity of the left was on full display in Oakland. The #AbolishICE protest was actually the execution of a warrant from an ongoing criminal investigation of a child sex trafficking! Great job snowflakes. 🙄”

“The Rigged Witch Hunt, originally headed by FBI lover boy Peter S (for one year) & now, 13 Angry Democrats, should look into the missing DNC Server, Crooked Hillary’s illegally deleted Emails, the Pakistani Fraudster, Uranium One, Podesta & so much more. It’s a Democrat Con Job!”

Repeated 157 times
Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

This is a breathtaking compendium of falsehoods and debunked conspiracy theories. There's no evidence that the special counsel investigation is a witch hunt or a hoax. In fact, the special counsel has revealed significant criminal activity by some of Trump's campaign advisers and by Russian individuals and entities. The investigation into potential collusion between Russia and Trump's campaign continues, and no conclusions have been announced. There's also no evidence that the Democrats colluded with Russia. Rather, there's more evidence they were victimized. FBI agent Peter Strzok, who was criticized by the DOJ inspector general for sending anti-Trump text messages in 2016, worked on special counsel Robert Mueller's team for two months in 2017, not a year. Trump also refers to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Mueller himself is a Republican. There’s no evidence Clinton deleted these 33,000 emails in anticipation of receiving a subpoena, and former FBI director James Comey has said the FBI’s investigation found no evidence that any work-related emails were “intentionally deleted in an effort to conceal them.” Clinton’s staff had requested that these emails be deleted months before they received a subpoena, according to the FBI’s July 2016 statement. "Pakistani fraudster" refers to Imran Awan, a naturalized U.S. citizen. The Justice Department has debunked several conspiracy theories fanned by right-wing websites about Awan's work in Congress. The conspiracy theories about Hillary Clinton and Uranium One, and about the DNC server, are likewise devoid of evidence.

Jul 6 2018

“Just won lawsuit filed by the DNC and a bunch of Democrat crazies trying to claim the Trump Campaign (and others), colluded with Russia. They haven’t figured out that this was an excuse for them losing the election!”

There's no evidence that the special counsel investigation is a witch hunt or a hoax. Topic: Jobs

Source: Twitter

Full story

Unemployment has been steadily declining since its peak in 2010. Moreover, Trump now uses data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics unemployment rate to say this, which is a flip-flop from his previous claims dismissing the BLS unemployment rate as "nonsense."

Jul 6 2018

“Six months in, TAX CUTS are already providing historic gains for minorities, women, and small businesses”

Topic: Taxes

Source: Twitter

Trump isn't specific about which gains minorities, women and small business have seen. He inherited a strong economy from Obama and so is giving himself too much credit. With about 126 million full-time workers in the United States, only about 5% have received these one-time bonuses. The unemployment rate has been steadily declining since 2010, but wages have haven't grown at the same rate.

Jul 5 2018

“Congress must pass smart, fast and reasonable Immigration Laws now. Law Enforcement at the Border is doing a great job, but the laws they are forced to work with are insane. When people, with or without children, enter our Country, they must be told to leave without our........ .....Country being forced to endure a long and costly trial. Tell the people “OUT,” and they must leave, just as they would if they were standing on your front lawn. Hiring thousands of “judges” does not work and is not acceptable - only Country in the World that does this!”

Repeated 11 times
Aug 2, 2018Jul 30Jul 5Jun 26Jun 25Jun 25Jun 25Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

Full story

This is a gross distortion of how immigration and asylum laws work. U.S. policy is to detain adults who are apprehended crossing the border illegally. Children and some adults in some cases are eligible for asylum or legal residence, and there's a vetting process to adjudicate their claims. The U.S. has around 350 immigration judges. There's no evidence that anyone is asking for thousands more. Trump says U.S. immigration laws are weak, but they are comparatively tough and it's the same system used by many countries.

Fact Checker rating:

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Oil prices rose after Trump terminated the Iran nuclear deal.

Oct 27, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 13Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 9Oct 9Oct 6Oct 6Oct 2Oct 2Oct 1Oct 1Sep 29Sep 26Sep 25Sep 24Sep 22Sep 21Sep 21Sep 21Sep 20Sep 20Sep 19Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 10Sep 8Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 6Sep 6Sep 5Aug 30Aug 30Aug 24Aug 24Aug 23Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 18Aug 17Aug 16Aug 16Aug 14Aug 12Aug 6Aug 4Jul 31Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jul 17Jul 16Jul 14Jul 14Jul 5Jul 3Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19Jun 17Jun 15Jun 14Jun 13Jun 9Jun 6Jun 5Jun 4

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the “greatest ever” goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come.

Jul 3 2018

“Many good conversations with North Korea-it is going well! In the meantime, no Rocket Launches or Nuclear Testing in 8 months. All of Asia is thrilled. Only the Opposition Party, which includes the Fake News, is complaining. If not for me, we would now be at War with North Korea!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump goes far out on a limb by saying the U.S. would be at war with North Korea but for him. The president indicates North Korea has let up its nuclear activities since he and Kim Jong Un signed a vague joint statement on denuclearization June 12. But experts say and satellite imagery indicates that North Korea continues to pursue a nuclear program. The Washington Post reported that U.S. spy agencies are seeing signs that North Korea is constructing new missiles at a factory that produced the country’s first intercontinental ballistic missiles capable of reaching the United States.

Source: Twitter

Full story

This Four Pinocchio claim somehow wound up on Trump's Twitter feed. It comes from a hard-line Iranian cleric who opposed the Iran nuclear deal. There's no evidence whatsoever to back up this claim. The Trump administration hasn't produced any, and Obama administration officials say it's bunk.

The Post does not make up sources and as a matter of course runs its reporting by the White House to seek comment before publication.

Sep 18, 2018Sep 18Sep 16Sep 15Sep 7Sep 4Aug 25Aug 23Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 14Aug 5Aug 1Jul 21Jul 10Jun 28Jun 15Jun 15Jun 7Jun 7May 29May 27May 26May 7May 4Apr 26Mar 19Jun 23, 2017

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Trump suggests that Mueller, a Republican, worked for Obama for 8 years but that's not true; moreover, he was appointed FBI director by George W. Bush.

Jun 25 2018

“Hiring many thousands of judges, and going through a long and complicated legal process, is not the way to go - will always be dysfunctional. Repeated 11 times
Aug 2, 2018Jul 30Jul 5Jun 26Jun 25Jun 25Jun 25Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

Full story

It’s not clear who told Trump 5,000 judges were needed. But this claim defies logic. The United States had 334 immigration judges as of mid-April, and a top official at the National Association of Immigration Judges says an additional 365 judges would be needed to get through the backlog. A bill by Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Tex.) would increase the total number of judges to 750, not 5,000. All the Article III judges, hearing all sorts of federal cases, at all the different levels, number only 1,300 or so — not in the thousands.

Jun 23 2018

“The National Association of Manufacturers just announced that 95.1% of Manufacturers 'have a positive outlook for their companies.' This is the best number in the Association’s history!”

Repeated 14 times
Sep 17, 2018Aug 13Jul 27Jul 26Jul 23Jul 19Jul 5Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 20

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Trump is citing the National Association of Manufacturers, a trade group that has been surveying members for 20 years. In the latest survey, released in June, medium and large manufacturers’ confidence had increased to 20-year highs but small manufacturers’ confidence had decreased. This survey, however, is not representative of all manufacturers. NAM members make up 6 percent of manufacturing firms. This is a very low level of coverage for a survey of this kind. The trade group declined to say whether its members are surveyed randomly.

Jun 23 2018

“Drudge Report 'OBAMA KEPT THEM IN CAGES, WRAPPED THEM IN FOIL' We do a much better job while at the same time maintaining a MUCH stronger Border! Mainstream Fake Media hates this story.”

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

The Obama administration was criticized for its treatment of Central American refugees, but what Trump is suggesting in this tweet is wrong. His administration also keeps some immigrants in caged enclosures and provides them with Mylar, or foil, blankets. Obama's administration did not systematically separate immigrant families, as Trump did.

“They do have, though, very strong Immigration Laws.”

Repeated 8 times
Jul 2, 2018Jun 22Jun 20Apr 30Apr 4Apr 3Apr 3Apr 2

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

As for Mexico having “very strong border laws,” PolitiFact reported that the White House pointed to a 2010 Washington Times article as evidence — but the Mexican law was changed in 2011 to decriminalize the act of entering the country without documentation and to allow undocumented immigrants to use education and health services. Moreover, Mexico’s own southern border is much more porous than the U.S. southern border.

Source: Twitter

Trump may believe the laws are "the world's worst," but Trump is mistaken — the U.S. has some of the most restrictive immigration laws. Plus, much of current immigration policy was decided either under a Republican president or through court cases and Democrats have offered at least four immigration deals that included funding for more border security.

Source: Twitter

Full story

In fact, families are being separated because of a "zero tolerance" policy from the Trump administration dating to April 2018. No law, whether passed by Democrats or otherwise, requires these separations. Essentially, Trump's executive order just retracted his own policy, which he could have reversed without an order.

Jun 20 2018

“RT "Boom: @ShopFloorNAM survey finds 0ver 95% of manufacturers bullish on future, ‘record optimism’ https://washex.am/2tpGq4O ”

Repeated 14 times
Sep 17, 2018Aug 13Jul 27Jul 26Jul 23Jul 19Jul 5Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 20

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Trump is citing the National Association of Manufacturers, a trade group that has been surveying members for 20 years. In the latest survey, released in June, medium and large manufacturers’ confidence had increased to 20-year highs but small manufacturers’ confidence had decreased. This survey, however, is not representative of all manufacturers. NAM members make up 6 percent of manufacturing firms. This is a very low level of coverage for a survey of this kind. The trade group declined to say whether its members are surveyed randomly.

Jun 20 2018

“Had a great meeting with the House GOP last night at the Capitol. They applauded and laughed loudly when I mentioned my experience with Mark Sanford. I have never been a fan of his!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Not a single lawmaker of the two dozen questioned by The Washington Post backed up Trump’s claim that they “applauded and laughed loudly” as he dissed Sanford, very few were willing to call out the president for creating an alternate reality.

Jun 20 2018

“Look what Fake ABC News put out. I guess they had it prepared from the 13 Angry Democrats leading the Witch Hunt! #StopTheBias”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Trump suggests that Mueller, a Republican, worked for Obama for 8 years but that's not true; moreover, he was appointed FBI director by George W. Bush.

Fact Checker rating:

While there was a wait to enter the rally, no reports found 10,000 people couldn't get in. Plus, Minnesota Public Radio noted the rally was "more than 8,000 people" not 9,000.

Jun 18 2018

“Children are being used by some of the worst criminals on earth as a means to enter our country. Has anyone been looking at the Crime taking place south of the border. It is historic, with some countries the most dangerous places in the world. Not going to happen in the U.S.”

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

Many Central American children who are sent with smugglers or coyotes or people who are not their parents are fleeing extreme violence and have legitimate asylum claims. But children don’t help adults (criminal or not) enter the country. Under current law, children receive safe harbor if they are thought to be trafficking victims and are “exempt from prompt return to their home country.” And any adult claiming to be a relative has to prove that claim through a rigorous screening process. The Department of Homeland Security itself notes that it has regularly separated children from adults who are not relatives.
