Full story

President Trump is taking the FBI Inspector General's remarks out of context. The report criticizes Comey's decision making process when he chose to announce the end of and reopening of the Clinton investigation, but the report found these moves were not politically motivated. There's no evidence that the special counsel investigation is a witch hunt or a hoax. In fact, the special counsel has revealed significant criminal activity by some of Trump's campaign advisers and by Russian individuals and entities. The investigation into potential collusion between Russia and Trump's campaign continues, and no conclusions have been announced. There also no evidence that the Democrats colluded with Russia. Rather, there's more evidence they were victimized.

Full story

Trump offers up a false conspiracy theory that the news media coordinates efforts to disparage him. Trump claims to have gotten "so much for peace in the world" because he and Kim Jong Un signed a vague joint statement on denuclearization June 12. But experts say and satellite imagery indicates that North Korea continues to pursue a nuclear program. The remains of U.S. soldiers lost in the Korean War had not been returned when Trump tweeted this, and what he describes as "finals" are actually fledgling negotiations between the two countries.

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the “best financial numbers” goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come. The unemployment rate at the end of May 2018 was the lowest in 18, not 44 years.

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the “greatest ever” goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come.

Jun 15, 2018Jun 14Jun 8Jun 8Apr 26Mar 19Jul 19, 2017Jul 10Jun 23Jun 9

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Former FBI Director James Comey said that the president's tweet about possible "tapes" of their conversations led him to believe their might be corroboration for the memos that he had written while still FBI director. Comey took contemporaneous notes following each of his meetings with the president and president-elect, which he shared with the senior leadership of the FBI. Comey intentionally wrote these in a way that the information wouldn't be classified.

Eric Schneiderman, are doing everything they can to sue me on a foundation that took in $18,800,000 and gave out to charity more money than it took in, $19,200,000. Topic:

Source: Twitter

New York state started investigating the Trump Foundation following a Washington Post investigation. The New York attorney general said the board of the Trump Foundation had not met since 1999. And without any outside supervision, the foundation came to serve the spending needs of Trump — and then, in 2016, the needs of his presidential campaign.

Sep 7, 2018Sep 7Sep 7Jul 26Jul 18Jun 19Jun 14Jun 12Jun 10Jun 1Mar 15Mar 14Mar 10Feb 26Feb 13Feb 12Jan 11Dec 28, 2017Dec 8Dec 5May 11May 4May 1Apr 28

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump says the Canadians say they “make 100 billion dollars” off trade with the United States, but Canada makes no such claim. The $100 billion number was not discovered because the Canadians were caught “bragging” but because his staff concocted a number by misleadingly citing a Canadian statistical website. The facts are not on Trump’s side when it comes to complaining about a trade deficit with Canada, because there is a trade surplus, according to numerous U.S. government reports.

Fact Checker rating:

Jun 14 2018

“Why should I, as President of the United States, allow countries to continue to make Massive Trade Surpluses, as they have for decades, while our Farmers, Workers & Taxpayers have such a big and unfair price to pay? Not fair to the PEOPLE of America! $800 Billion Trade Deficit...'

Repeated 33 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 24Oct 17Oct 12Oct 1Sep 26Aug 31Aug 30Aug 28Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jun 25Jun 23Jun 14Jun 12Jun 9Jun 2May 17Mar 10Mar 9Mar 7Mar 6Mar 6Mar 5Mar 3Mar 2Nov 20, 2017Nov 15Nov 11Apr 2Mar 20Mar 15

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The U.S. trade deficit in 2017 was $566 billion, according to the Commerce Department. Trump gets his $800 billion number by looking only at the deficit for trade in goods ($810 billion) even though U.S. trade in services runs a substantial surplus of $244 billion. Trump regularly complains about the trade deficit with China, saying it is $500 billion. But it was $310 billion in 2016. The goods deficit in 2017 was $375 billion, but that will be lower when the trade in services figure is calculated.

Jun 14 2018

“....And add to that the fact that the U.S. pays close to the entire cost of NATO-protecting many of these same countries that rip us off on Trade (they pay only a fraction of the cost-and laugh!). The European Union had a $151 Billion Surplus-should pay much more for Military!”

Repeated 49 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 23Oct 17Oct 12Oct 11Oct 6Oct 2Oct 1Sep 20Sep 17Aug 21Jul 25Jul 24Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 13Jul 13Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 5Jul 1Jun 29Jun 28Jun 27Jun 27Jun 26Jun 25Jun 23Jun 15Jun 14Jun 12Jun 7Jun 1May 17Apr 28Apr 27Apr 16Apr 12Apr 12Apr 12Mar 14Mar 10Mar 6Mar 5Mar 3Jan 28

Topic:

Source: Twitter

The United States does not pay almost entire cost of NATO, far from it. The actual trade deficit with the EU is about $100 billion because the U.S. has a services surplus of about $50 billion. Trump's focus on the trade deficit is misplaced, as the United States and the EU have total trade in goods of more than $700 billion, with U.S. exports to the EU in 2015 supporting more than 2.6 million U.S. jobs, according to the Census Bureau.

Jun 14 2018

“....Germany pays 1% (slowly) of GDP towards NATO, while we pay 4% of a MUCH larger GDP. Does anybody believe that makes sense? We protect Europe (which is good) at great financial loss, and then get unfairly clobbered on Trade. Change is coming!”

Repeated 87 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 22Oct 17Oct 16Oct 14Oct 12Oct 12Oct 9Oct 9Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 4Sep 4Aug 30Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 21Aug 14Aug 14Aug 2Jul 30Jul 26Jul 18Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 14Jul 14Jul 13Jul 13Jul 13Jul 12Jul 12Jul 12Jul 11Jul 11Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 10Jul 5Jul 5Jul 5Jul 5Jun 29Jun 25Jun 23Jun 14Jun 12Apr 27Apr 18Apr 3Apr 3Apr 3Mar 8Dec 18, 2017Dec 8Nov 15Jul 6Jul 6Jun 9Jun 2May 30May 27May 25May 25May 25May 25May 8Apr 29Apr 29Apr 21Mar 22Mar 18Mar 17Feb 28

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump never gets this correct. There are two types of funding for NATO: direct funding and indirect funding. Direct funding, for military-related operations, maintenance and headquarters activity, is based on gross national income — the total domestic and foreign output claimed by residents of a country — and adjusted regularly. With the largest economy in NATO, the United States pays the largest share — about 22 percent. Germany is second, with about 15 percent. A significant portion of the U.S. share is operating the Airborne Early Warning and Control System (AWACS) fleet, according to the Congressional Research Service. The U.S. share of the actual military budget is negotiated each year, but largely based on the cost-sharing formula, and amounts to less than $500 million a year, according to Defense Department documents. That’s chump change in a $700 billion military budget. As for indirect funding, since 2006, each NATO member has had a guideline of spending at least 2 percent of gross domestic product on defense spending. At a 2014 summit, responding to Russian aggression in Ukraine, NATO members pledged to meet that guideline by 2024. As of 2017, 12 of the 28 members exceed the guideline — with the United States leading the way at 3.6 percent. But this is simply money that each country would spend on its own military — or on missions that do not include NATO, such as peacekeeping in Africa.

Fact Checker rating:

Jun 13 2018

“So funny to watch the Fake News, especially NBC and CNN. They are fighting hard to downplay the deal with North Korea. 500 days ago they would have “begged” for this deal-looked like war would break out. Our Country’s biggest enemy is the Fake News so easily promulgated by fools!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Trump invents a narrative here that did not happen.

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Oil prices rose after Trump terminated the Iran nuclear deal.

Jun 13 2018

“We save a fortune by not doing war games, as long as we are negotiating in good faith - which both sides are!”

Repeated 3 times
Jun 13, 2018Jun 12Jun 12

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Trump apparently offered this unilateral concession to North Korea without consulting with the Pentagon or the government of South Korea. It’s unclear what the annual war games cost. Trump offered no figures for his claiming of saving “a tremendous amount of money.” South Korea pays about 50 percent of the total non-personnel costs of U.S. troop presence on the peninsula, according to the Congressional Research Service. Given that this is a training exercise, troops still need training, so presumably canceling this particular exercise will not reduce such expenses.

Repeated 35 times
Oct 29, 2018Oct 27Oct 26Oct 19Oct 15Oct 12Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 9Oct 6Oct 4Sep 29Sep 25Sep 25Sep 24Sep 21Sep 19Sep 18Sep 7Sep 6Aug 30Aug 23Aug 23Aug 20Aug 19Aug 7Jul 24Jun 26Jun 25Jun 21Jun 20Jun 13Jun 13Jun 12

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

North Korea has a long history of making agreements and then not living up to its obligations. The document signed by Trump and Kim was not “very comprehensive” but remarkably vague, leaving it open to interpretation and debate, compared to previous documents signed by North Korea. The statement said North Korea (officially the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea, or DPRK) committed to “work towards the complete denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula.” The phrase is not defined and “toward” is rather weak. In the past, North Korea viewed “denuclearization” to mean the United States removing the nuclear umbrella it provides to Japan and South Korea; there is no indication its definition has changed.

Topic: Jobs

Source: Twitter

Full story

This is a flip-flop. During the 2016 campaign, Trump used to claim a Four-Pinocchio stat that 58 percent of African-American youth was unemployed. The official Bureau of Labor Statistics unemployment rate for black youth at the time was 19.2 percent — about one-third of the rate used by Trump. Now that he’s president, Trump appears all too happy to cite the unemployment rate for African Americans, bragging that it’s the best since the turn of the century. We’re pleased the president is now using accurate statistics but it’s absurd to suggest, as he does to audiences, that he had anything to do with these numbers.

Jun 9 2018

“The United States will not allow other countries to impose massive Tariffs and Trade Barriers on its farmers, workers and companies. While sending their product into our country tax free. We have put up with Trade Abuse for many decades — and that is long enough.”

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The U.S. also imposes tariffs and has other barriers on imports; it's not a "tax free" situation, as he says. Trump complains about tariffs imposed by other countries but the United States supports American farmers with subsidies that other countries complain gives them an unfair competitive advantage. China, for instance, complains that subsidies from the U.S. government have given American soybean farmers an unfair competitive advantage in selling to China.

Jun 9 2018

“PM Justin Trudeau of Canada acted so meek and mild during our @G7 meetings only to give a news conference after I left saying that, “US Tariffs were kind of insulting” and he “will not be pushed around.” Very dishonest & weak. Our Tariffs are in response to his of 270% on dairy!”

Repeated 39 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 27Oct 24Oct 12Sep 29Sep 26Sep 26Sep 26Sep 21Sep 21Sep 20Sep 20Sep 7Sep 7Sep 5Sep 5Aug 31Aug 30Aug 27Aug 24Aug 21Aug 16Jul 26Jul 18Jul 1Jun 28Jun 27Jun 25Jun 23Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19Jun 15Jun 12Jun 9Jun 9Jun 8Jun 7

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Trump's tariffs on steel and aluminum were not imposed in response to Canada's tariffs on dairy. Canada does have high dairy tariffs once a quota is reached, just as the United States props up sugar prices. But Canada's overall tariffs are lower than the United States -- and Canada made large dairy concessions in the Trans Pacific Partnership agreement negotiated by Barack Obama, which Trump pulled out of in the early days of his presidency. The United States has “a favorable quota,” according to the Brookings Institution, meaning it runs a trade surplus on dairy products and “no dairy products are sold to Canada outside the quota, so no U.S. exports really pay a high tariff.” According to the World Bank, here are the average tariff rates charged by G-7 nations: US: 1.6%; EU: 1.6%; UK: 1.6%; Italy: 1.6%; Germany: 1.6%; France: 1.6%; Japan: 1.4%; Canada: 0.8%

“Obama, Schumer and Pelosi did NOTHING about North Korea, and now weak on Crime, High Tax Schumer is telling me what to do at the Summit the Dems could never set up. Schumer failed with North Korea and Iran, we don’t need his advice!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Trump is unusually ungracious to his predecessors, especially considering he has only just embarked on negotiations. Bill Clinton negotiated a nuclear agreement with North Korea that froze its plutonium program and was working on a missile deal when he departed office. But that agreement fell apart under George W. Bush. But then Bush tried to negotiate a deal, even lifting sanctions on North Korea. But that deal fell apart once Obama was elected. In each case, North Korea used the arrival of a new president to wiggle out of its commitments.

Repeated 29 times
Sep 18, 2018Sep 18Sep 16Sep 15Sep 7Sep 4Aug 25Aug 23Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 14Aug 5Aug 1Jul 21Jul 10Jun 28Jun 15Jun 15Jun 7Jun 7May 29May 27May 26May 7May 4Apr 26Mar 19Jun 23, 2017

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Trump suggests that Mueller, a Republican, worked for Obama for 8 years but that's not true; moreover, he was appointed FBI director by George W. Bush.

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

The Russian investigation was being handled by the Justice Department, until Trump fired FBI director James Comey. That led to the appointment of a special prosecutor.

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Trump suggests that Mueller, a Republican, worked for Obama for 8 years but that's not true; moreover, he was appointed FBI director by George W. Bush.

Fact Checker rating:

Jun 7 2018

“Our Justice Department must not let Awan & Debbie Wasserman Schultz off the hook. The Democrat I.T. scandal is a key to much of the corruption we see today. They want to make a “plea deal” to hide what is on their Server. Where is Server? Really bad!”

Topic: Crime

Source: Twitter

Trump appears to embrace a conspiracy theory as he takes the unusual step of commenting on a criminal case. The case surrounding Imran Awan and his wife has been the subject of interest among conservatives and conspiracy theorists for more than a year. They were charged last year with conspiring to commit bank fraud and making false statements on a loan application and unlawful monetary transactions. But conservatives have suggested the couple were engaged in something much worse because Awan was an IT specialist for House lawmakers. An internal review found he and colleagues seemed to be bending rules on computer network access so they could share job duties. The Justice Department has debunked several conspiracy theories fanned by right-wing websites about Awan's work in Congress.

Jun 7 2018

“The Obama Administration is now accused of trying to give Iran secret access to the financial system of the United States. This is totally illegal. Perhaps we could get the 13 Angry Democrats to divert some of their energy to this 'matter' (as Comey would call it). Investigate!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Full story

This is false. The Treasury Department had granted a license to an Omani bank, in a one-time transaction, convert Iranian bank holdings from Omani rials into euros. The exchange never took place because U.S. banks still did not want to do it despite the license. With their carefully parsed statements, Obama administration certainly were not forthright to lawmakers at the time about the effort. But the granting of the license was not illegal.

Fact Checker rating:

Jun 7 2018

“Why isn’t the European Union and Canada informing the public that for years they have used massive Trade Tariffs and non-monetary Trade Barriers against the U.S. Totally unfair to our farmers, workers & companies. Take down your tariffs & barriers or we will more than match you!”

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Trump is focused on a few isolated examples. Overall, EU tariffs are no higher than the United States. According to the World Bank, here are the average tariff rates charged by G-7 nations: US: 1.6%; EU: 1.6%; UK: 1.6%; Italy: 1.6%; Germany: 1.6%; France: 1.6%; Japan: 1.4%; Canada: 0.8%

Jun 6 2018

“Thank you to everyone at @FEMA HQ for today’s briefing on preparations for the upcoming hurricane season. Disaster response and recovery is best achieved when it’s federally supported, state managed, and locally executed – this is the successful model we will continue to build.”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

According to a Washington Post report, Trump spent most of the briefing talking about his accomplishments not being briefed on the coming hurricane season.

Jun 6 2018

“...Four reporters spotted Melania in the White House last week walking merrily along to a meeting. They never reported the sighting because it would hurt the sick narrative that she was living in a different part of the world, was really ill, or whatever. Fake News is really bad!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

It's not clear if four reporters saw Melania during her hiatus from public view., but at least two did — once while she was walking with aides to the West Wing and once at a closed press event.

Jun 5 2018

“The HISTORIC Rescissions Package we’ve proposed would cut $15,000,000,000 in Wasteful Spending! We are getting our government back on track.”

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Trump's rescission request is a drop in the bucket, representing roughly 1 percent of the $1.3 trillion omnibus spending bill he signed in March 2018. The U.S. budget deficit has been growing under Trump because of the combined effect of spending and tax cuts. It was $532.24 billion from October 2017 through May 2018, a 23 percent increase from the year-earlier period, and will surpass $1 trillion by 2020, two years sooner than previously estimated, according to the Congressional Budget Office. Moreover, there's no guarantee Congress will agree to any of the rescission requests. And it's worth noting that what Trump calls "wasteful spending" were actually line items included in a bill he signed into law.

Jun 5 2018

“Imagine how much wasteful spending we’d save if we didn’t have Chuck and Nancy standing in our way! For years, Democrats in Congress have depleted our military and busted our budgets on needless spending, and to what end? No more.”

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

The U.S. budget deficit has been growing under Trump and a Republican-controlled Congress because of the combined effect of spending and tax cuts. The deficit was {$532.24 billion} from October 2017 through May 2018, a 23 percent increase from the year-earlier period, and will surpass $1 trillion by 2020, {two years sooner} than previously estimated, according to the Congressional Budget Office. Trump signed a $1.3 trillion omnibus spending bill in March 2018. The military budget had declined in recent years, as a result of decreases in funding for Overseas Contingency Operations as both the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan came to a close, not because it was "depleted."

Jun 5 2018

“Separating families at the Border is the fault of bad legislation passed by the Democrats. Border Security laws should be changed but the Dems can’t get their act together! Started the Wall.”

Repeated 17 times
Sep 4, 2018Sep 4Jun 22Jun 22Jun 21Jun 21Jun 20Jun 20Jun 20Jun 20Jun 19Jun 18Jun 16Jun 15Jun 15Jun 15Jun 5

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

Full story

In fact, families are being separated because of a "zero tolerance" policy from the Trump administration dating to April 2018. No law, whether passed by Democrats or otherwise, requires these separations.

Fact Checker rating:

Jun 5 2018

“The U.S. has an increased economic value of more than 7 Trillion Dollars since the Election. May be the best economy in the history of our country. Record Jobs numbers. Nice!”

Repeated 4 times
Jul 12, 2018Jun 6Jun 6Jun 1

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

This appears to be based on the performance of the Russell 3000 Index since Trump's inauguration. This index includes nearly 98 percent of U.S. stocks, but the market capitalization of the top U.S. companies is not necessarily an indicator of wealth gains for the general population.

Jun 5 2018

“The Russian Witch Hunt Hoax continues, all because Jeff Sessions didn’t tell me he was going to recuse himself...I would have quickly picked someone else. So much time and money wasted, so many lives ruined...and Sessions knew better than most that there was No Collusion!”

Repeated 157 times
Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Justice Department regulations required Attorney General Jeff Sessions to recuse himself from the Russia investigation. DOJ officials are not allowed to investigate political campaigns of which they were a part, and Sessions was an early and active Trump surrogate during the 2016 presidential race. There's no evidence that the special counsel investigation is a witch hunt or a hoax. In fact, the special counsel has revealed significant criminal activity by some of Trump's campaign advisers and by Russian individuals and entities. The investigation into potential collusion between Russia and Trump's campaign continues, and no conclusions have been announced.

Jun 4 2018

“In many ways this is the greatest economy in the HISTORY of America and the best time EVER to look for a job!”

Repeated 80 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 23Oct 22Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 13Oct 11Oct 10Oct 9Oct 9Oct 9Oct 6Oct 6Oct 2Oct 2Oct 1Oct 1Sep 29Sep 26Sep 25Sep 24Sep 22Sep 21Sep 21Sep 21Sep 20Sep 20Sep 19Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 10Sep 8Sep 7Sep 7Sep 6Sep 6Sep 6Sep 5Aug 30Aug 30Aug 24Aug 24Aug 23Aug 23Aug 21Aug 21Aug 18Aug 17Aug 16Aug 16Aug 14Aug 12Aug 6Aug 4Jul 31Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jul 17Jul 16Jul 14Jul 14Jul 5Jul 3Jun 23Jun 21Jun 20Jun 19Jun 17Jun 15Jun 14Jun 13Jun 9Jun 6Jun 5Jun 4

Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump can be pleased with the state of the economy but calling it the “greatest ever” goes way too far, as it can’t top the late 1990s or the stellar growth in parts of the 1940s, 1960s and 1980s, according to key data. Wage growth is also disappointing compared with what it was in prior boom times, and the deficit has also surged, which experts warn could be a drag on the economy for years to come.

Fact Checker rating:

Jun 4 2018

“This is my 500th. Day in Office and we have accomplished a lot - many believe more than any President in his first 500 days. Massive Tax & Regulation Cuts, Military & Vets, Lower Crime & Illegal Immigration, Stronger Borders, Judgeships, Best Economy & Jobs EVER, and much more.”

Repeated 37 times
Oct 20, 2018Oct 16Oct 4Sep 25Sep 24Sep 18Sep 7Sep 7Sep 5Sep 5Sep 5Sep 4Aug 23Jun 25Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 15Jun 4Apr 28Apr 26Jan 10Dec 27, 2017Dec 23Dec 22Dec 22Dec 8Nov 29Nov 26Nov 5Nov 2Oct 17Aug 22Aug 11Jul 25Jul 19Jul 17

Topic: Biographical record

Source: Twitter

Trump, unlike many presidents in their first year, has signed few major pieces of legislation. As of Dec. 21, Trump has signed 94 bills, most of which were minor. That's fewer bills than any president since Eisenhower, according to GovTrack. At the time Trump made this statement he had signed more bills than Obama and was tied with George W. Bush, but was still behind every other president since Eisenhower.

Jun 4 2018

“We had Repeal & Replace done (and the saving to our country of one trillion dollars) except for one person, but it is getting done anyway. Individual Mandate is gone and great, less expensive plans will be announced this month. Drug prices coming down & Right to Try!”

Repeated 28 times
Oct 17, 2018Oct 13Oct 10Oct 4Sep 7Aug 21Aug 16Aug 13Aug 4Aug 4Aug 1Jul 31Jul 26Jul 23Jul 5Jun 28Jun 23Jun 20Jun 19Jun 4May 4Apr 28Feb 23Nov 29, 2017Oct 16Sep 6Aug 22Aug 15

Topic: Health care

Source: Twitter

Trump suggests that Sen. John McCain's vote was the only impediment to passing a repeal and replacement of the Affordable Care Act. But none of the substantive replacement bills got nearly enough votes, and McCain's vote was against a "skinny" repeal that was only to lead to talks with the House on a common position, with no guarantee of an agreement that would pass both Houses.

Jun 4 2018

“As has been stated by numerous legal scholars, I have the absolute right to PARDON myself, but why would I do that when I have done nothing wrong? In the meantime, the never ending Witch Hunt, led by 13 very Angry and Conflicted Democrats (& others) continues into the mid-terms!”

Repeated 1 time
Jun 8, 2018

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

This startling claim would likely be challenged all the way to the Supreme Court, if Trump actually took this politically perilous step. Legal scholars would dispute whether Trump has an "absolute right" to self-pardon since it's never been tested.

Jun 4 2018

“The U.S. has made such bad trade deals over so many years that we can only WIN!”

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Trump keeps claims the United States would win a trade war but most economists says no one wins in a trade war and that it often ends up being economically damaging.

Jun 4 2018

“The Philadelphia Eagles Football Team was invited to the White House. Unfortunately, only a small number of players decided to come, and we canceled the event. Staying in the Locker Room for the playing of our National Anthem is as disrespectful to our country as kneeling. Sorry!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Trump suggests the team had challenged him on his stance on football players kneeling during the national anthem -- to silently protest police brutality and racial inequality -- but no Eagles players had engaged in the practice.

Jun 4 2018

“China already charges a tax of 16% on soybeans. Canada has all sorts of trade barriers on our Agricultural products. Not acceptable!”

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Trump complains about tariffs imposed by other countries but the United States supports American farmers with subsidies that other countries complain gives them an unfair competitive advantage. China, for instance, complains that subsidies from the U.S. government have given American soybean farmers an unfair competitive advantage in selling to China.

Jun 4 2018

“Farmers have not been doing well for 15 years. Mexico, Canada, China and others have treated them unfairly. By the time I finish trade talks, that will change. Big trade barriers against U.S. farmers, and other businesses, will finally be broken. Massive trade deficits no longer!”

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Trump fails to understand that the trade deficit is not only the result the buying of goods and services but is impacted by other macroeconomic factors, such as the relative strength of currencies, economic growth rates, and savings and investment rates. The president's tax bill will almost surely widen trade deficits because it is causing the budget deficit to spike, so the United States must borrow more from foreign investors.

Jun 2 2018

“The United States must, at long last, be treated fairly on Trade. If we charge a country ZERO to sell their goods, and they charge us 25, 50 or even 100 percent to sell ours, it is UNFAIR and can no longer be tolerated. That is not Free or Fair Trade, it is Stupid Trade!”

Repeated 28 times
Oct 18, 2018Oct 12Sep 26Aug 31Jun 28Jun 26Jun 9Jun 8Jun 2May 10May 5Apr 12Mar 10Mar 10Mar 8Mar 6Mar 2Feb 23Jan 10Dec 8, 2017Dec 5Nov 12Nov 11Oct 22Oct 17Jul 28Apr 28Feb 23

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Full story

It's not that hard to find countries with which the U.S. runs a trade surplus in goods. At the top of the list are Hong Kong, the Netherlands, the United Arab Emirates, Belgium and Australia. Additionally, there are several items where the U.S. levies tariffs on trading partners.

Jun 2 2018

“When you’re almost 800 Billion Dollars a year down on Trade, you can’t lose a Trade War! The U.S. has been ripped off by other countries for years on Trade, time to get smart!”

Repeated 33 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 24Oct 17Oct 12Oct 1Sep 26Aug 31Aug 30Aug 28Jul 26Jul 24Jul 24Jun 25Jun 23Jun 14Jun 12Jun 9Jun 2May 17Mar 10Mar 9Mar 7Mar 6Mar 6Mar 5Mar 3Mar 2Nov 20, 2017Nov 15Nov 11Apr 2Mar 20Mar 15

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The U.S. trade deficit in 2017 was $566 billion, according to the Commerce Department. Trump gets his $800 billion number by looking only at the deficit for trade in goods ($810 billion) even though U.S. trade in services runs a substantial surplus of $244 billion. Trump regularly complains about the trade deficit with China, saying it is $500 billion. But it was $310 billion in 2016. The goods deficit in 2017 was $375 billion, but that will be lower when the trade in services figure is calculated.

Jun 2 2018

“The Mueller team is stacked with anti-Trumpers, who actually represented Clinton people (& gave $’s to Crooked H).” Dan Bongino”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Trump suggests that Mueller, a Republican, worked for Obama for 8 years but that's not true; moreover, he was appointed FBI director by George W. Bush.

Fact Checker rating:

Full story

There are different ways of counting Mueller's expenses and Trump is using the absolute maximum. The investigation into possible collusion between Russia and Trump's campaign continues, and no conclusions have been announced. There's no evidence Democrats colluded with Russia.

May 31 2018

“Iger, where is my call of apology? You and ABC have offended millions of people, and they demand a response. How is Brian Ross doing? He tanked the market with an ABC lie, yet no apology. Double Standard!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Trump is referring to ABC News reporter Brian Ross, who was suspended after making an error in a report last year when he said Trump had directed his national security adviser, Michael Flynn, to make contact with the Russians during the 2016 presidential campaign. Ross later corrected the report, noting that Trump made the request after the election when he was the president-elect, not a candidate. Ross and ABC News apologized for the mistake. So Trump is wrong to say there was no apology.

May 31 2018

“Not that it matters but I never fired James Comey because of Russia! The Corrupt Mainstream Media loves to keep pushing that narrative, but they know it is not true!”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Trump himself has said he fired Comey because of the "Russia thing." He made the comment in an interview with Lester Holt of NBC News, shortly after firing Comey. He also told Russian officials in the Oval Office: “I just fired the head of the F.B.I. He was crazy, a real nut job. I faced great pressure because of Russia. That’s taken off.”

May 31 2018

“The corrupt Mainstream Media is working overtime not to mention the infiltration of people, Spies (Informants), into my campaign! Surveillance much?”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

It has been reported that an FBI informant in Europe, a professor named Stefan Halper, met with at least three people working on the Trump campaign in Europe. So far, there has been nothing to indicate whether there was a political agenda or a “spy” mandate as part of Halper's assistance for the FBI, which started after the agency opened a counterintelligence probe. There is no evidence he was paid a "fortune." Trump appears to be referring to payments made for an unrelated project for the Defense Department, which started before Trump announced his campaign for presidency.

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, Mueller, a registered Republican, under federal law is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. Mueller is not legally authorized to investigate Clinton's campaign.

Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

In fact, special counsel Robert Mueller is investigating Russia, so it's not clear why Trump is suggesting he do so. There's no reason to believe Mueller's investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election is a "witch hunt," especially since it has yielded concrete evidence of Russian meddling, including the indictments of Russian individuals and entities. Mueller is not legally authorized to investigate Hillary Clinton, the FBI, the Justice Department, Barack Obama, Jim Comey or Loretta Lynch.

May 28 2018

“Happy Memorial Day! Those who died for our great country would be very happy and proud at how well our country is doing today. Best economy in decades, lowest unemployment numbers for Blacks and Hispanics EVER (& women in 18years), rebuilding our Military and so much more. Nice!”

Repeated 91 times
Oct 26, 2018Oct 23Oct 23Oct 23Oct 20Oct 17Oct 11Oct 8Oct 2Oct 2Sep 29Sep 20Sep 7Sep 7Sep 5Sep 5Sep 4Sep 2Aug 31Aug 31Aug 30Aug 27Aug 27Aug 16Aug 13Aug 13Aug 4Aug 1Aug 1Jul 27Jul 26Jul 24Jul 23Jul 19Jul 18Jul 16Jul 5Jul 3Jul 1Jun 29Jun 28Jun 27Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 20Jun 19Jun 18Jun 11Jun 7Jun 6Jun 6Jun 1May 28May 24May 24May 10May 4Apr 28Apr 27Apr 26Apr 18Apr 16Apr 12Mar 20Mar 13Mar 10Mar 6Feb 26Feb 24Feb 23Feb 12Feb 5Feb 1Jan 30Jan 28Jan 28Jan 26Jan 24Jan 19Jan 18Jan 16Jan 16Jan 16Jan 10Jan 8Jan 8Jan 6Sep 6, 2017Jul 25

Topic: Jobs

Source: Twitter

This rather unusual Memorial Day tweet is a flip-flop. During the 2016 campaign, Trump used to claim a Four-Pinocchio stat that 58 percent of African-American youth was unemployed. The official Bureau of Labor Statistics unemployment rate for black youth at the time was 19.2 percent — about one-third of the rate used by Trump. Now that he’s president, Trump appears all too happy to cite the unemployment rate for African Americans, bragging that it’s the best in history. We're pleased the president is now using accurate statistics but it’s silly to suggest, as he does to audiences, that he had much to do with these numbers.

“Remember, the Nancy Pelosi Dems are also weak on Crime, the Border and want to be gentle and kind to MS-13 gang members...not good!”

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

Democrats generally do not advocate for illegal immigration, and have repeatedly put forth immigration bills that both include a DACA solution and new border security measures. It's silly for Trump to claim they want to be "kind and gentle" to gang members.

Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

It's not clear who Trump is referring to, but the investigation into possible links between the Trump campaign and Russian operatives continues, there is no indication it is "phony" and no conclusions have been reached.

May 27 2018

“Why didn’t the 13 Angry Democrats investigate the campaign of Crooked Hillary Clinton, many crimes, much Collusion with Russia? Why didn’t the FBI take the Server from the DNC? Rigged Investigation!”

Repeated 29 times
Sep 18, 2018Sep 18Sep 16Sep 15Sep 7Sep 4Aug 25Aug 23Aug 20Aug 20Aug 17Aug 14Aug 5Aug 1Jul 21Jul 10Jun 28Jun 15Jun 15Jun 7Jun 7May 29May 27May 26May 7May 4Apr 26Mar 19Jun 23, 2017

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. As for the DNC server, the FBI and the Democratic National Committee disagree on whether the FBI requested access to the DNC's servers. FBI Director James Comey testified to the Senate Intelligence Committee that the bureau made "multiple requests at different levels" to access DNC's servers, but the DNC said the FBI never requested access. The DNC ultimately allowed a private company to review its database and share findings with the FBI.

Fact Checker rating:

May 27 2018

“Why didn’t President Obama do something about the so-called Russian Meddling when he was told about it by the FBI before the Election? Because he thought Crooked Hillary was going to win, and he didn’t want to upset the apple cart! He was in charge, not me, and did nothing.”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

President Obama did do something about the Russian interference in the U.S. election. He spoke to the Russian president and he notified Congressional Leadership asking that they release a bipartisan statement. The Republican leadership declined to act. Obama, however, was careful not to do anything in the public eye for fear of the perception he was tipping the election.

“Put pressure on the Democrats to end the horrible law that separates children from there parents once they cross the Border into the U.S. Catch and Release, Lottery and Chain must also go with it and we MUST continue building the WALL! DEMOCRATS ARE PROTECTING MS-13 THUGS.”

Repeated 62 times
Oct 27, 2018Oct 26Oct 25Oct 22Oct 22Oct 20Oct 19Oct 18Oct 13Oct 10Oct 9Oct 6Oct 6Oct 6Oct 4Oct 1Oct 1Sep 15Sep 7Sep 6Aug 30Aug 24Aug 21Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 13Jul 31Jul 24Jul 17Jul 10Jul 5Jul 5Jul 1Jun 30Jun 27Jun 26Jun 25Jun 23Jun 22Jun 21Jun 21Jun 21Jun 20Jun 20Jun 19Jun 19Jun 16Jun 2May 28May 26May 24May 24May 21Apr 4Apr 2Mar 7Jan 27Jan 21Dec 6, 2017Nov 29Nov 5

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

It's preposterous to say Democrats are protecting MS-13. They generally do not advocate for illegal immigration, and have repeatedly put forth immigration bills that both include a DACA solution and new border security measures. (The president's proposals do not even attract the votes of all Republicans.) The "horrible law" that Trump is referencing are not laws at all but court cases that have set legal precedent. The separation of children that Trump appears to condemn is actually a policy set forth by his own administration; he could end it if he wanted to.

May 26 2018

Unlike what the Failing and Corrupt New York Times would like people to believe, there is ZERO disagreement within the Trump Administration as to how to deal with North Korea...and if there was, it wouldn’t matter. The @nytimes has called me wrong right from the beginning!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

The New York Times is not failing, and in fact has seen subscriptions spike since Trump was elected. And all administrations have policy disputes, especially over North Korea.

May 26 2018

“The Failing @nytimes quotes 'a senior White House official, who doesn’t exist, as saying 'even if the meeting were reinstated, holding it on June 12 would be impossible, given the lack of time and the amount of planning needed.' WRONG AGAIN! Use real people, not phony sources.”

Topic: Immigration

Source: Twitter

Trump is referring to an official who briefed reporters at the White House, under background rules set by the White House press office. Reasonable people may disagree how the Times paraphrased the official's quotes, but he was real person.

May 26 2018

“With Spies, or 'Informants' as the Democrats like to call them because it sounds less sinister (but it’s not), all over my campaign, even from a very early date, why didn’t the crooked highest levels of the FBI or 'Justice' contact me to tell me of the phony Russia problem?”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

This is false. NBC News has reported that just after Trump won the GOP nomination in the summer of 2016, he received a high-level briefing from the FBI telling him “that foreign adversaries, including Russia, would probably try to spy on and infiltrate his campaign.” House Speaker Paul Ryan told CBS News that congressional leaders of both parties sent a letter to secretaries of state around the country before the election warning that their election data was vulnerable to Russian hacking. "We all knew this before the election. We all knew, Russia was trying to meddle with our election,” Ryan said.

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

It has been reported that an FBI informant in Europe, a professor named Stefan Halper, met with at least three people working on the Trump campaign in Europe. So far, there has been nothing to indicate whether there was a political agenda or a “spy” mandate as part of Halper's assistance for the FBI, which started after the agency opened a counterintelligence probe. There is no evidence he was paid a "fortune." Trump appears to be referring to payments made for an unrelated project for the Defense Department, which started before Trump announced his campaign for presidency.

The informant worked for the FBI. The Clinton campaign did not place him there. There is no evidence the informant was used for "political advantage." May 21 2018

“I ask Senator Chuck Schumer, why didn’t President Obama & the Democrats do something about Trade with China, including Theft of Intellectual Property etc.? They did NOTHING! With that being said, Chuck & I have long agreed on this issue! Fair Trade, plus, with China will happen!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

President Trump may disagree with the trade tactics that the Obama administration used, but to say that they "did nothing" isn't accurate. The Trans-Pacific Partnership (which Trump withdrew from in early 2017) included measures that would have required the Chinese to change certain practices in order to join. The Trump administration has continued to enforce an Obama-era agreement on hacking which included theft of intellectual property.

May 21 2018

“China has agreed to buy massive amounts of ADDITIONAL Farm/Agricultural Products - would be one of the best things to happen to our farmers in many years!”

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

The exact amount of agricultural products that China has agreed to buy has not been announced. The soybean saga came about after China retaliated to Trump's threats of tariffs by cancelling a long-standing trade deal to import American soybeans. It's not clear if the proposed new deal would benefit farmers.

May 21 2018

“On China, Barriers and Tariffs to come down for first time.”

Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

This is false. China reduced trade barriers when it was admitted to the World Trade Organization in 2001.

While the dossier commissioned by Fusion GPS for Democrats contained salacious elements, broad portions have proven to be largely correct. Fusion has said the former British spy who wrote it received $168,000. The FBI was sufficiently impressed that it considered pay him for additional research. Brennan informed the Obama administration and the gang of eight that he had evidence that Russia was trying to meddle in the U.S. election.

May 20 2018

“The Witch Hunt finds no Collusion with Russia - so now they’re looking at the rest of the World. Oh’ great!”

Repeated 157 times
Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

The investigation into possible links between the Trump campaign and Russian operatives continues, and no conclusions have been reached. There's no reason to believe it is a "witch hunt." This tweet came on the heels of a New York Times story reporting that special counsel Robert Mueller was looking into interactions between Donald Trump Jr. and others in the president's circle and "an Israeli specialist in social media manipulation ... [and] an emissary for two wealthy Arab princes." The facts as reported by the Times have not been challenged.

May 20 2018

“I hereby demand, and will do so officially tomorrow, that the Department of Justice look into whether or not the FBI/DOJ infiltrated or surveilled the Trump Campaign for Political Purposes - and if any such demands or requests were made by people within the Obama Administration!”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

It has been reported that an FBI informant in Europe, a professor named Stefan Halper, met with at least three people working on the Trump campaign in Europe. So far, there has been nothing to indicate whether there was a political agenda in Halper's assistance to the FBI, which started after the agency opened a counterintelligence probe. No evidence has surfaced to prove Trump's related claim that President Barack Obama had Trump wiretapped.

May 20 2018

“What ever happened to the Server, at the center of so much Corruption, that the Democratic National Committee REFUSED to hand over to the hard charging (except in the case of Democrats) FBI? They broke into homes & offices early in the morning, but were afraid to take the Server?”

Repeated 16 times
Aug 30, 2018Jul 17Jul 16Jul 14Jul 1May 20Apr 26Apr 18Nov 11, 2017Aug 10Jul 9Jul 7May 7Apr 30Mar 20Mar 5

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

The FBI and the Democratic National Committee disagree on whether the FBI requested access to the DNC's servers. Former FBI Director James Comey testified to the Senate Intelligence Committee that the bureau made "multiple requests at different levels" to access DNC's servers, but the DNC said the FBI never requested access. The DNC ultimately allowed a private company to review its database and share findings with the FBI. Comey testified that his staff told him this arrangement was an "appropriate substitute."

May 20 2018

“....and why hasn’t the Podesta brother [Tony Podesta] been charged and arrested, like others, after being forced to close down his very large and successful firm? Is it because he is a VERY well connected Democrat working in the Swamp of Washington, D.C.?”

Repeated 6 times
May 20, 2018Apr 18Aug 3, 2017Jul 25May 12Apr 30

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

It's strange to see Trump calling for the indictment of Tony Podesta, a longtime Democratic lobbyist whose firm closed in 2017. Podesta's lobbying firm was investigated by special counsel Robert Mueller for allegedly assisting Trump's former campaign chairman, Paul Manafort, in his Ukraine-related work. The Podesta Group was identified in Manafort's indictment as "Company B," but Podesta himself was not charged. In calling for Podesta to face charges, Trump could be said to be tacitly acknowledging the legitimacy of Mueller's investigation -- which the president often calls a witch hunt -- and the indictment of his former campaign chairman.

May 20 2018

“Now that the Witch Hunt has given up on Russia and is looking at the rest of the World, they should easily be able to take it into the Mid-Term Elections where they can put some hurt on the Republican Party. Don’t worry about Dems FISA Abuse, missing Emails or Fraudulent Dossier!”

Repeated 157 times
Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

This tweet wraps in a slew of false or misleading claims. There's no reason to believe special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation is a "witch hunt," and no indication that it has dropped its focus on Russian interference in the 2016 election. Mueller’s investigation has yielded concrete evidence of Russian interference, including the indictments of Russian individuals and entities. Trump's tweet came on the heels of a New York Times story that reported Mueller's team also was looking into interactions between Donald Trump Jr. and others in the president's circle and and "an Israeli specialist in social media manipulation ... [and] an emissary for two wealthy Arab princes." The facts as reported by the Times have not been challenged. The chain of events that led to the Mueller investigation began with a tip from the Australian government, which notified U.S. authorities about a drunken conversation between a Trump campaign adviser, George Papadopoulos, and an Australian diplomat. Papadopoulos claimed the Russians had “political dirt” on Clinton. The much-discussed Steele dossier that Trump references, and that his supporters claim sparked the Mueller probe, came afterward. There is no evidence the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA) application to monitor another Trump campaign adviser, Carter Page, was used to spy on the Trump campaign. On Sept. 26, 2016, Page announced that he was taking “a leave of absence” from the campaign. On Oct. 21, the FBI received a FISA court order to begin surveillance on Page. So that was just days before the election — and after Page was no longer part of the campaign. The order was renewed at least three more times over the next year, meaning that the FBI was able to convince the judges — all appointed by Republicans — that surveillance continued to help investigators. Trump also mentions "missing emails," which is likely a reference to the 33,000 emails missing from Hillary Clinton's private email server. They remain unaccounted for.

May 20 2018

“Things are really getting ridiculous. The Failing and Crooked (but not as Crooked as Hillary Clinton) @nytimes has done a long & boring story indicating that the World’s most expensive Witch Hunt has found nothing on Russia & me so now they are looking at the rest of the World!”

Repeated 157 times
Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation has yielded concrete evidence of Russian interference, including the indictments of Russian individuals and entities. Trump's tweet came on the heels of a New York Times story that reported Mueller's team also was looking into interactions between Donald Trump Jr. and others in the president's circle and and "an Israeli specialist in social media manipulation ... [and] an emissary for two wealthy Arab princes." The facts as reported by the Times have not been challenged. Mueller's investigation has cost $7.7 million in direct costs during its first year and another $9 million in indirect costs that the Justice Department says it would have incurred regardless of the existence of the special counsel's office. Some investigations cost exponentially more money.

“ ....At what point does this soon to be $20,000,000 Witch Hunt, composed of 13 Angry and Heavily Conflicted Democrats and two people who have worked for Obama for 8 years, STOP! They have found no Collusion with Russia, No Obstruction, but they aren’t looking at the corruption... ...in the Hillary Clinton Campaign where she deleted 33,000 Emails, got $145,000,000 while Secretary of State, paid McCabes wife $700,000 (and got off the FBI hook along with Terry M) and so much more. Republicans and real Americans should start getting tough on this Scam.”

Repeated 157 times
Oct 29, 2018Oct 19Oct 16Oct 16Oct 14Oct 13Oct 11Oct 11Oct 9Oct 8Sep 26Sep 26Sep 24Sep 20Sep 20Sep 18Sep 17Sep 17Sep 16Sep 15Sep 12Sep 7Sep 7Sep 7Sep 4Sep 1Aug 30Aug 23Aug 22Aug 22Aug 22Aug 21Aug 21Aug 20Aug 20Aug 19Aug 19Aug 17Aug 15Aug 14Aug 14Aug 12Aug 10Aug 9Aug 6Aug 5Aug 1Jul 31Jul 27Jul 22Jul 22Jul 21Jul 19Jul 17Jul 17Jul 17Jul 16Jul 16Jul 16Jul 15Jul 14Jul 13Jul 11Jul 7Jul 7Jul 6Jul 5Jul 1Jul 1Jun 28Jun 28Jun 28Jun 27Jun 23Jun 23Jun 20Jun 18Jun 18Jun 17Jun 16Jun 15Jun 14Jun 8Jun 5Jun 2Jun 2May 30May 29May 29May 27May 26May 23May 23May 20May 20May 20May 20May 18May 17May 17May 15May 7May 2May 2May 2Apr 18Apr 18Apr 11Apr 9Feb 24Feb 10Feb 10Feb 3Jan 25Jan 16Jan 11Jan 10Jan 10Jan 10Jan 6Jan 6Jan 5Dec 28, 2017Dec 28Dec 28Dec 15Dec 12Nov 26Nov 11Oct 27Oct 25Oct 25Oct 18Oct 16Oct 11Oct 10Sep 22Sep 22Aug 3Jul 29Jul 23Jul 12Jul 9Jun 22May 12May 10Apr 28Apr 5Apr 1Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Mar 20Feb 26Feb 24Feb 16Feb 7

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

These tweets are replete with suspect claims. Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that special counsel Robert Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, Mueller is a registered Republican, and under federal law, he is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them. The investigation continues and no conclusions have been announced as to any collusion between Trump's campaign and Russia, nor as to obstruction of justice. Mueller's investigation has not cost $20 million. Official reports show the special counsel's investigation has incurred $7.7 million in direct costs (rent, salaries, supplies and the like) through March 2018, and another $9 million in indirect costs that the Department of Justice says it "would have incurred for the investigations irrespective of the existence of the SCO [special counsel's office]." Mueller is not legally authorized to investigate the 33,000 emails that went missing from Clinton's private email server in 2016. Trump insinuates that Clinton should be investigated for collecting $145 million as secretary of state. This is a reference to the "Uranium One" deal, a sale of uranium from the United States to a foreign company. The suggestion is that Clinton approved this uranium sale in exchange for a $145 million contribution to the Clinton Foundation. But it was not up to Clinton alone to approve the Uranium One deal, but to nine different cabinet members including her. The New York Times reported that Clinton may not have participated in the discussions. Also, $131.3 million of the money was donated to the Clinton Foundation by Uranium One's founder, who had divested from the firm three years before the deal, and a year and a half before Clinton became secretary of state. The Times reported that a Canadian investor in Uranium One contributed $2.35 million to the Clinton Foundation around the time of the deal, while Clinton was secretary of state. Andrew McCabe, the former acting FBI director whom Trump fired, became part of the investigation of Clinton’s emails long after his wife, Jill McCabe, unsuccessfully ran for a Virginia state Senate seat. The political action committee of then-Virginia Gov. Terry McAuliffe (D) gave $452,500 to McCabe, and the state Democratic Party gave her campaign an additional $207,788. That was about one-third of the $1.8 million budget for her campaign. McAuliffe is close to Clinton, but there is no evidence she knew of the contributions. Moreover, it stretches the imagination that McAuliffe would know that the husband of someone he was supporting in a Virginia legislative race was going to be promoted months later to a position of authority in the email case.

May 18 2018

“Why isn’t disgraced FBI official Andrew McCabe being investigated for the $700,000 Crooked Hillary Democrats in Virginia, led by Clinton best friend Terry M (under FBI investigation that they killed) gave to McCabe’s wife in her run for office? Then dropped case on Clinton!”

Repeated 14 times
Oct 11, 2018Aug 11May 18Apr 28Apr 26Apr 15Mar 17Jan 24Dec 24, 2017Dec 23Dec 3Jul 26Jul 25Jul 19

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

The question of fired deputy FBI director Andrew McCabe’s wife’s political activities emerged during the campaign, and Trump constantly has gotten the details incorrect. In this quote, Trump added the unfounded claim that McCabe kept some of this money. On March 12, 2015, Jill McCabe, a hospital physician, announced her candidacy for the Virginia Senate. The political action committee of then-Gov. Terry McAuliffe (D), a close Clinton ally, gave $452,500 to McCabe, and the state Democratic Party gave her campaign $207,788. That was about one-third of the $1.8 million budget for her campaign. All of the money was spent and there is no evidence McCabe kept any of it. He did not participate in his wife’s campaign.

The investigation into possible links between the Trump campaign and Russian operatives continues, and no conclusions have been reached. There's no reason to believe it is a "witch hunt." The assertion that the Russia investigation is illegal is false. Topic: Trade

Source: Twitter

Trump regularly complains about the trade deficit with China, saying it is $500 billion. But it was $310 billion in 2016. The goods deficit in 2017 was $375 billion, but that will be lower when the trade in services figure is calculated. And as we've explained before, a trade deficit does not mean a country is "losing money," instead it means that a country has the capitol to be able to purchase more goods or services.

ZTE was in trouble because it had repeatedly violated restrictions on trade with Iran and North Korea and because it was deemed a national security threat by the Pentagon.

May 13 2018

“Remember how badly Iran was behaving with the Iran Deal in place. They were trying to take over the Middle East by whatever means necessary. Now, that will not happen!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

The Iran deal was intended to halt Iran's drive to produce a nuclear weapon and did not address its regional ambitions. Even the Trump administration conceded that Iran was complying with the requirements of the nuclear deal.

May 12 2018

“Iran’s Military Budget is up more than 40% since the Obama negotiated Nuclear Deal was reached...just another indicator that it was all a big lie. But not anymore!”

Repeated 1 time
May 8, 2018

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Iran's military expenditure grew nearly 30 percent from 2015, when the JCPOA was adopted, to 2017, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute. The value of Iran's currency is sliding, and GDP growth has fallen since the first year of the JCPOA, but GDP still was expected to grow at a healthy rate of 4 percent in 2018, according to the BBC.

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Trump has been slow to submit nominations to fill his government, and many have significant vetting problems. meanwhile, Trump's judicial nominations are moving through the Senate at a record pace.

Source: Twitter

Major media outlets routinely report that the Justice Department's antitrust division opposes this merger, and in fact, much of their coverage focuses on developments in the trial Trump that complains is being ignored.

Topic: Health care

Various health-care experts dispute Trump's claim that his plan to lower prescription drug prices would cut costs meaningfully for consumers. Trump once promised to allow Medicare to negotiate drug prices, but this did not end up in his plan.

May 9 2018

“Congratulations to Mike Dewine on his big win in the Great State of Ohio. He will be a great Governor with a heavy focus on HealthCare and Jobs. His Socialist opponent in November should not do well, a big failure in last job!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

Mike Dewine is running against the former director of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Richard Cordray to become governor of Ohio. Cordray is a registered Democrat and was endorsed by Sen. Elizabeth Warren (D-Mass.).

May 8 2018

“The Iran Deal is defective at its core. If we do nothing, we know what will happen. In just a short time, the world’s leading state sponsor of terror will be on the cusp of acquiring the world’s most dangerous weapons....”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

Full story

The JCPOA prohibits Iran from building nuclear weapons indefinitely; other international agreements to which Iran has committed itself also prohibit the development of such weapons. However, critics of the JCPOA have voiced concerns that — despite these strictures — Iran could keep working toward nuclear weapons capability under the guise of pursuing peaceful goals, such as a nuclear energy program. Trump is alluding to the fact that some restrictions in the JCPOA on centrifuge capacity, uranium enrichment and international monitoring sunset over time.

May 7 2018

“The Russia Witch Hunt is rapidly losing credibility. House Intelligence Committee found No Collusion, Coordination or anything else with Russia. So now the Probe says OK, what else is there? How about Obstruction for a made up, phony crime.There is no O, it’s called Fighting Back.”

Repeated 11 times
Jul 29, 2018Jul 5May 7Apr 27Apr 27Apr 26Apr 18Mar 23Mar 17Mar 13Mar 12

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

The House Intelligence Committee made no such conclusion. The Republican majority offered preliminary conclusions, released in a one-page summary of a draft 150-page report, which said they found “no evidence of collusion, coordination, or conspiracy” between the Trump campaign and Russia. Democrats on the committee have said that the investigation was incomplete and that key witnesses had not been interviewed. The House panel investigation has been deeply split along partisan lines from the start, in contrast to a parallel Senate inquiry.

May 7 2018

“The 13 Angry Democrats in charge of the Russian Witch Hunt are starting to find out that there is a Court System in place that actually protects people from injustice...and just wait ‘till the Courts get to see your unrevealed Conflicts of Interest!”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

Trump is referring to the team of lawyers that Mueller has assembled. Eleven out of 16 attorneys on Mueller's team made public so far have contributed to Democrats, including Clinton and Obama. The other five have no record of political contributions, though the Daily Caller says 13 are registered Democrats. One attorney who donated the maximum amount represented the Clinton Foundation in a 2015 lawsuit. Another attorney without a record of political donations represented a Clinton aide at one point. Both attorneys worked for WilmerHale, a firm that also represents Trump's former campaign manager, Paul Manafort, as well as Ivanka Trump and Jared Kushner. Moreover, under federal law, Mueller is not allowed to consider the political leanings of his staff when hiring them.

Trump is talking about two former FBI officials— James A. Baker and Lisa Page. Both officials resigned and neither has been charged with any wrongdoing in the Justice Department's investigation of leaks. Baker told the New York Times, he was leaving for the Brookings Institution.

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

The investigation into possible links between the Trump campaign and Russian operatives continues, and no conclusions have been reached.

May 2 2018

“'The questions are an intrusion into the President’s Article 2 powers under the Constitution to fire any Executive Branch Employee...what the President was thinking is an outrageous.....as to the President’s unfettered power to fire anyone...' Joe Digenova, former US Attorney”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

This is a reference to the list of questions written by Trump's lawyers after a meeting with investigators from the special counsel's office in March 2018. Determining motive ("what the president was thinking," in this case) is a key part of any criminal investigation. Article II does not explicitly bar prosecutors from asking questions of the president, and no court has reached this conclusion.

May 1 2018

It is unclear who leaked the questions to The New York Times but it was later determined these were questions assembled by Trump's lawyers based on conversations with the special prosecutor, not questions that the prosecutor had submitted. At least 13 of the questions dealt with collusion.

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Sometimes in Washington, the cover-up is worse than the crime. If the president had consulted with a lawyer, he would have learned that obstructing justice can take place without an underlying crime. Moreover, the prosecutor has already obtained guilty pleas from former Trump aides admitting to crimes.

Apr 29 2018

“Just got recent Poll - much higher than President O at same time....Well, much more has been accomplished!”

Topic: Miscellaneous

Source: Twitter

It's not clear which poll Trump is referring to. But he often tweets about Rasmussen, a right-leaning poll that consistently rates Trump higher than most other polls. Obama had a rating of 47 percent on April 27, 2010, whereas Trump was also at 47 percent on April 27. In the 538 poll average, Obama was at 48 percent and Trump at 40 percent at the end of April in their second year in office.

Oct 18, 2018Sep 7Sep 6Sep 6Jul 5Apr 28Apr 28

Topic: Miscellaneous

Tester led the public charge against the Jackson nomination to run the Department of Veterans Affairs and released a memo that contained unverified claims against the Jackson, based on interviews of people who worked with Jackson. Topic: Economy

Source: Twitter

U.S. auto sales actually declined from 2016 to 2017. Michigan added a total of 17,000 from April 2017 to March 2018, according to the Current Population Survey, and actually lost jobs in November, December, January and February.

Apr 28 2018

“'Clapper lied about (fraudulent) Dossier leaks to CNN' @foxandfriends Fox News He is a lying machine who now works for Fake News CNN.”

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Full story

There is no evidence that former Director of National Intelligence James Clapper lied about leaking the dossier to CNN. The theory is that Clapper pushed then-FBI director James B. Comey to brief President-elect Donald Trump about the dossier with salacious material about Trump in Russia and then tipped CNN’s Jake Tapper about the briefing so CNN would have a hook to report on the dossier’s existence. But Clapper told The Fact Checker that the first time he ever "interacted" with Tapper was on May 14, 2017, four months after the dossier leaked. Clapper said interaction – that means interviews, emails, text messages, anything. The two men simply did not have a relationship.

Fact Checker rating:

Apr 27 2018

“Just Out: House Intelligence Committee Report released. “No evidence” that the Trump Campaign “colluded, coordinated or conspired with Russia.” Clinton Campaign paid for Opposition Research obtained from Russia- Wow! A total Witch Hunt! MUST END NOW!”

Repeated 11 times
Jul 29, 2018Jul 5May 7Apr 27Apr 27Apr 26Apr 18Mar 23Mar 17Mar 13Mar 12

Topic: Russia

Source: Twitter

Trump highlights the "no collusion" conclusion of a report approved only with Republican votes. But he ignores that the report faulted the Trump campaign for accepting meetings with Russian operatives in hopes of getting "dirt" on Hillary Clinton. And while Trump again highlights the "dossier," the report confirmed that the FBI counterintelligence investigation began not with the dossier but with a tip about a Trump campaign operative who appears to have heard about the hacking of Democratic emails from a Russian operative.

Topic: Russia

But he ignores that the report faulted the Trump campaign for accepting meetings with Russian operatives in hopes of getting "dirt" on Hillary Clinton. And while Trump again highlights the "dossier," the report confirmed that the FBI counterintelligence investigation began not with the dossier but with a tip about a Trump campaign operative who appears to have heard about the hacking of Democratic emails from a Russian operative. The special counsel was appointed because Trump fired FBI Director James Comey.

Apr 25 2018

“Busy day planned. Looking forward to watching President Macron of France address a Joint Session of Congress today. This is a great honor and seldom allowed to be done...he will be GREAT!”

Topic: Foreign policy

Source: Twitter

An address to the joint session to Congress by a foreign leader is not as rare as Trump suggests. Four leaders -- Pope Francis, Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, Afghan president Mohammad Ashraf Ghani and Israeli Prime Minister Binyamin Netanyahu -- made such a speech just in 2015. Macron is the 8th French president to make such a speech.
